I never had such a rude food service experience. tried her best to get rid of us before even getting seated. after telling us it would be a 45 min wait she shut the door in my face. seated people ahead of us who waited in line behind us. spilt our drinks on our table and just left the mess there. left our food on the counter for 10 mins before serving it to us. truly awful experience. plus $20 (no tip) for smootie, 2eggs, 2bacon, 2waffles and a few beans. but the food was good. it was prob excellent if it wasn't sitting for 10mins.

First attempt at the this place was on a cold winter morning. Walked a long way to get there and noticed a big lineup. Thought to myself hmm this place is popular. Was quickly confused when half of the restaurant had empty seating, and the staff walked around like tired zombies. Turns out the they couldn't service a full restaurant properly. Management lacks communication and customer service.

Food is best described with one word "garbage" this place is more about being a cool hipster place to hang, than it is about good food. Got the eggs Benny with salmon, it tasted awful. Service is half decent at best.

Coffee was surprisingly meh. Service was wildly odd but the waffle was incredible!
We were seated, so far so good. Order taken - server may have just started her first shift ever in a restaurant. Waited 15 minutes got a dirty side plate. That got taken away. Got some water. Nice. Got a waffle. No coffee.
We watched one of the coffees got to a different table, then back to the front counter, then to our table. I asked after my coffee and it arrived cold and lonely after all the other eating and drinking had already been finished. 

Hard to hear the music was so loud. Not a great restaurant for chatting in. Cash only and hectoring signs about having all your party present before being seated were not really appreciated either. 

Couldn't wait for the bill so I paid at the counter. Couldn't wait to leave actually.
Waffle was unbeliveably fantastic but the rest of the experience made it tricky to enjoy.
Staff need to be trained. Plates need to be clean and coffee needs to be good. May not try it again.

The first and only time I came here...I ordered their chicken and waffles and it was not worth the hype. The chicken was as expected, but the waffle was dry and the two just didn't go together. I didn't understand why everyone was raving about this dish, and so I was disappointed. I also had to wait a while in line, which I don't mind at all if the food is worth it. This was not.

The food is a 4- the service bumps it down to a 3.
The waffles are very nice and the servings are big. The fact that they're made with potatoes is a cool touch. Overall worth going but not in my top brunches in T. (still v. good though!)

The problem is that the servers can be very brusque. We were waiting in doors because it was a cold day and there were seats for two available so we weren't taking up any seating but one server kept coming up and making comments even though no one was being harmed by us being there and we'd ordered drinks while we waited for the rest of our staff.

When we sat down we got a table of 4 for 3 people and 2 min after we sat another friend joined. They made a huge fuss how they dont seat until the whole party is there, which makes sense, however there would be absolutely NO difference to the table we'd get between 3 people and 4 people.

It just felt like they were very persnickety which put a damper on the beginning of the meal.
The Food was good and our waitress was great! It is very quiet and peaceful. It is great for groups and my friends and I would come again very soon. Keep it up

I went for brunch here today with a friend and I was really disappointed in the food considering all that I've heard about this place. I ordered the mini waffles, scrambled egg and cheese, hollandaise sauce and an americano. I was surprised when the server said they didn't serve coffee as it's a brunch joint. Seems kinda sacrilegious for a breakfast place to not have coffee. The americano wasn't the greatest and the cup was really small.

The food arrived maybe 15 minutes after we ordered and the presentation and portion sizes were good. However, the waffles were meh. They tasted like they had too much baking powder in them. After a healthy dollop of maple syrup, they were edible. The scrambled egg and cheese had no salt and tasted really bland.

Unlike the food, the service was definitely 5 stars. My server was awesome, very attentive and friendly. Just wish the food could have matched the service.

Went on a Sunday afternoon for brunch. Got there with my party of 4 at 1:15ish and was seated at 2:30. 

There were only 4 tables that fits 4 and the rest were 2-seaters. So be prepared. 

While waiting, the smell of their cherry chocolate latte caught my attention so I had to order it. It was DELICIOUS. 

2 of my brunch mates got their peanut butter chocolate banana smoothie and have raving reviews.

We started with an order of bacon waffles with maple syrup. Yummy! 

I opted for the breakfast Benny w/ fruit. (You can choose fruit, potato salad, or baked beans with all entrees)

Breakfast Benny was 2 poached eggs, caramelized bacon on potato waffles with hollandaise. 

I personally find the potato pancakes a little too rich and heavy for breakfast/brunch. 
 
But worth a return trip for the drinks and maybe I'll opt for something lighter as a main. 

But for sure next time will be a table for 2 and much earlier.

Everything waffles! Amazing! Fair warning though, you will likely have to wait a good while, especially on weekends. That being said, atmosphere was nice, service was really friendly and food was so good! Had a Starving 4 Waffles, which is an order of 4 waffles with choice of toppings that comes with greens and fruit salad. Fruit and veg were fresh, waffles were crispy on the outside and deliciously soft on the inside. The two Americanos we ordered were also great. My brunch date ordered the waffle benny and said it was delicious too, and our completely clear plates at the end of the meal were pretty good indicators! Their dessert waffles also sounded amazing, guess I'll have to come back for those...

My only complaints are that one, the syrup at the table wasn't real maple syrup (!!!) - this for me is important, and my delicious waffles could have been taken to the next level with the real stuff. I'd even pay more to have it! Second, they only take cash which we didn't realize. There's an ATM in the restaurant but that resulted in getting dinged $2 for a transaction which was kind of a drag. But otherwise everything was great. Glad to have this place in the neighbourhood, would definitely return!

I have never felt the need to write a negative review but this place certainly earned it. It took two waitresses and ten minutes to clean the table for us. It was neither busy or even messy. We got seated right by the kitchen which is completely open to the entire restaurant. Not only did I get to watch a chef repeatedly stick his hands all the way inside the trash and not wash his hands prowe ply afterwards (he did a quick rinse), cans but the dude doing the dishes was poorly rinsing the dishes. Still trying to give the place a fair chance I ignore these things. Food comes and there is a beautiful piece long black hair on the plate under/in the food and a lovely blonde hair stuck on my knife. Best part is the waitresses was standing right by me when I pulled the hair out of my food and she literally said nothing and walked away. All around awful experience and it sucks because the food was good.

Went here for a birthday brunch this afternoon. We were seated right away, probably because we missed the peak brunch hours. The waitress was off in lala land even when taking orders. Our drinks took about 20 min to come. I ordered the fully loaded waffles - potato waffles, sour cream, cheese bacon and chives. It was amazing!! It was like eating a baked potato. It comes with your choice of potato salad, fruit or baked beans. I choice the fruit it was a good selection not just a few dinky grapes and some berries. My only complaint was the mixed green salad, the dressing tasted like dirt. 
My mom and dad had the tex me sandwich both said they enjoyed it, and it had a nice little tingle on the tongue in terms of heat. My dad got the baked beans and he said they were actually pretty good. 
My boyfriend ventured for the Sammy Benny which at his first bite was ohhhing and ahhhing. 
The service however, as I mentioned was off in nowheresville, the server was so slow, we waited about 30 min for our bill and eventually had to ask another server which was clearing tables for our cheque. Why do you ask? Because our server was sitting down eating her lunch with a co worker chatting.  Overall the food is pretty epic but the service needs work. Also a little makeover would help as the place is a dive but that is no reason not to go. 4 stars for the food, 2 for the service, 3 overall.

Starving artist? More like starving customers! 

I've been here a couple of times before, usually for a late lunch on the weekend. Last visit was on a Sunday at about 2:30. The restaurant was busy so a waitress said we could wait at the bar for a table to become available. As we were waiting, another couple was seated as soon as they arrived. Not cool. I mention it to the waitress and we are seated a couple of minutes later but it's all down hill from here. 

My latte took 25 minutes to arrive. Food was even slower, my appetizer arrived after my main and the waitress walked away when I asked for some hot sauce. Even paying the bill was a complete hassle. 

This place just sucks when it comes to customer service. Not worth the headache.

What can I say about The Starving Artist other than waffles. Waffles, waffles, waffles. To quote their menu, everything is either a waffle, served with waffles, or served on top of waffles. 

Is it heaven? Pretty much. 

I went not too long ago with a friend and had a great experience. While we were nervous that we would have to wait in line for hours (the Internet is a scary place that cautions that The Starving Artist can be quite busy on weekends), we were able to get a table straight away and got to eating quickly. We both had traditional breakfasts with bacon, cheddar scrambled eggs, and of course, waffles. I had regular waffles and my friend had potato; both were out of this world delicious. One thing I was incredibly delighted by was the amount of fruit that was served with our meal; so many brunch places charge an extra four dollars for a small plate for fruit, but this was included in the meal which was under $10. 

I'll definitely be back again as it is now a personal goal to consume all of the waffles on the menu.

This place is decent if your craving breakfast waffles. Went here on an early Sunday morning so as expected it was packed. You'll probably end up waiting 10-15 minutes in line depending on how many people you are with.

The waiters were very attentive and our food came after some time. Now the selection of waffles is pretty good so you wont have too much difficulty deciding what to order. For $15-20 it's more than reasonable.

Great new location. Love the food here. For some reason the size of the coffee cups are larger here than the ones they serve at the lansdowne location. The only reason i am giving 3 stars is because the server i had that particular day didnt seem like she was having a good day. When i asked for a $20 bill to be broken up for the tip all i got was bills back. It seemed quite inappropriate. And, although i was going to leave $5 anyway, i would have appreciated the choice to begin with. 

I visit this place at least once a week. It'll be unfortunate if i have to tip that server again.
Long line on Sunday and too many bees outside. But the food was great, good service, good smoothies. Waffle everything.

There's always a lineup at the Starving Artist on Lansdowne, so a friend and I decided to check out the new location on St. Clair for lunch. Sadly, there won't be lineups here if our experience is the norm. 

Service was p-a-i-n-f-u-l-l-y slow and when our lattes finally did arrive, I can confidently say it was the worst latte I've had in Toronto. Do they use a packaged coffee mix? It had some weird, overly-sweet chemical taste that was really off-putting. 

Our lunch arrived soon after the coffee, but sans cutlery. We requested some and waited 5 minutes. My lunch partner finally went and got it herself. 

My vegie sandwich was fresh, but the fruit on the side had seen better days. And seriously, I know waffles are the house specialty, but a waffle sandwich is over the top. And waffles with my friend's spicy TexMex 'sandwich' were just weird .

The room itself is nice...and that's about the only good thing I can say. There's lots of space between tables, which makes it super comfortable for guests with babies and strollers...a rarity in Toronto restaurants...so I can see it could be a popular spot for those with young children.

Finally, payment was by Cash Only. Oh, there is an ATM in the corner (with a $1.99 fee). This cash grab was really annoying and I was tempted not to tip at all, but I don't think the staff are at fault for the issues with this restaurant.

So, considering the combination of poor service and odd menu options (unless you adore all waffles, all the time), I won't be back.

The first time I've tried potato waffles and I can't get enough. The food and friendliness of the staff are a definite 5, but be careful going on a weekend when you may be neglected due to how busy it gets. Weekdays are your best friends at this location.

The best waffles in town. Anyone I bring/tell to go here always enjoys.

The potato waffles are so good. If you go with another person split meals, so you have one potato waffle and one sweet waffle (with fruit for dessert). I'll definitely be back.

Pretty decent waffles, etc. I like this location because they aren't any wasps (insect variety) like the original spot on Lansdowne. The downside to this place is that there are a lot of babies. 

Babies or Wasps? Your call.

Not sure why it took me so long to start coming to this place.

Great waffles (especially the very interesting potato ones...mashed potatoes done in a waffle grill) - and nice coffee. 

Only serious complaint is that while dining in the summer, Starving Artist has hands-down the WORST wasp problem I've ever experienced. And twice. I'm not sure what the issue here is, but it can seriously ruin your meal. The staff even brought a fly swatter over to our table to help combat them. You know what's more disgusting that wasps flying everywhere over your head and on your food? Having a well-used fly-swatter on the table. 

Outside of that, those waffles are pretty good. 

So I'll give this place 4/5 during most months of the year, but a 0-1/5 during that wasp season.

God-damn Wasps.

I was so excited to go to this place and I am glad I did! I got the mini waffles with hollandaise sauce. My friend got the potato waffles with salad. So good! I loved everything about the meal. The waffles were freshly made and the hollandaise sauce tasted marvellous. Don't even get me started on the potato waffles! I ended up eating one of my friends cause they were sooo good. Nicely seasoned and one of a kind. I went during the week so we walked right in. Can't speak for the weekend but I would assume it would be quite busy. Well worth it!

I went back to Starving Artist on a Sunday for brunch because I was so impressed with their potato waffles my last visit. Not quite a latka, the potato waffles are made in a waffle maker which creates a thin crispy crust and a fleshy interior. Ingenious!  My last visit, I also had perfectly poached eggs with runny yolks and a devilishly good Hollandaise glaze. 

So there was no mistake that I would order the B. Benny which marries both of those elements together!

Unfortunately this visit was horrendous in terms of service!  Granted we were a large group of 10 and they usually are packed on the weekends, but it should not have taken an hour to get our food. At the very least, give us an update if you are running behind. There was no apology!  As expected, my eggs were overcooked. Go on a weekday if you still want to try them and and remain unscathed from this review!

Another good reason to venture out to this neighbourhood besides the Value Village is this breakfast place.  I had their blueberry waffle with ice cream.  Yum!  This place gets busy...tables are closely set beside others and it can get loud.  My friend ordered the Waffle Benny, no complaints.  (I think everything on their menu comes with waffles.)

I haven't been here in the evenings so not sure if it is just as busy.

I am giving them the benefit of the doubt because I've been to this location before and because I like the food, but overall, in the times I've been, I haven't been especially impressed with the service, and today was especially problematic. 

BlogTO recently included Starving Artist on its list of most kid-friendly brunch places, with a special mention of the St Clair location. On the surface, I'd agree -- what kid doesn't like waffles? But if you have to wait 45m for your order, your kids are going to be very unhappy campers. 

Now, to be fair, it was Monday morning, and they were both understaffed and training what staff were actually there. But only one experienced server was on hand, which, even on a slow day, makes life difficult for everyone. You can't leave a single trainee chef in the kitchen without backup. All the staff were stressed, which impaired the service noticeably: we were barely acknowledged when we arrived; there was a considerable wait to be seated; the orders were mixed up; one of the kids was served last despite her order being the simplest... and we got very few updates to reassure us. 

Despite all this, we all enjoyed our food. To compensate us for our less than ideal experience, the manager (?) on duty reduced our bill. I still think, from what I've seen in the past, that they have a ways to go smoothing out some service issues, and they are chronically understaffed. It'd be nice to see this place thrive in this neighbourhood, but it will be a while before we go back.

Went here for my mother in law's bday this morning. We managed to make it in before the line up became insane. Ordered the eggs waffle benny and the hitchhiker waffles. All excellent. Specifically candied bacon. What's better than candy and bacon really?

All in all a quick and delicious meal that did not disappoint.

This review is mostly because of service, because our food was really good and unique. But our reception upon entering the restaurant really soured the experience. The place was empty when we came in. We let the girl behind the bar know that we were waiting for two more. She rudely told us we had to wait at the bar, and couldn't be seated. I'm aware that this is a common thing to do...........but when the restaurant is full or close to. There was one other table seated! Another girl jumped into to cover the extreme lack of tact, and said it was fine. I told her that of course if it got busy and we were still waiting, we'd move to the bar. It didn't, and our friends arrived within 5 minutes. Over the course of our meal we watched the first girl offend three other parties in some way. She acted like we were children coming to brunch in her living room. She needs to get a clue or leave the service industry.

Food was really good. I got the Fully Loaded, which was great because I don't eat eggs, and find it a real pain to go for brunch and find something on the menu to eat. It was FANTASTIC. So good that we're going to try and replicate it ourselves.

The not so great? The coffee is STRONG. Many people like it that way, so its not a real detriment. We also got the waffle bacon to start. Its labeled as "Waffle coated bacon" Really, its waffle strips and some of them have bacon inside. For $6?? Really? Don't bother with it.

this was my second time going there and I would go back again. it was very busy but they seated us very quickly. when we were sitting, the service was slow and they didn't bring us water. once we got the food it was very good.l

The starving artist is starving for a reason. If you're craving waffles find a waffle place, if you're craving experiments that are called "waffles"; this is the place to go. The whole atmosphere came off as a tacky attempt at "hipster". The server seems extremely stressed despite the fact that we were one of 3 tables occupied in the joint. This place certainly has the potential to be a good restaurant, but it seems the they can't put the pieces together to do so.

Do you LOVE waffles?

Does the very idea of  a waffle incursion on almost every item on a restaurant menu excite you?  Do your doodles contain subconscious waffle patterns?

If all of this sizzling waffle talk has gotten your iron heated, then by all means - Jump on over to the Landsdowne station and give Starving Artist a try.  The waffles benny was prepared precisely to my spec and I am a fan.  Have tried the Hitchhiker on another occaision and, with the addition of avocado, found it to be a splendid cure for the common brekkie sandwich.  Coffee is quite good - liked the french press a lot on one of those high volume mornings and a very nicely pulled americano when one was enough.

I found the service to be stellar on each of my several trips - once during busy brunch, once in the evening, and one strange late afternoon business lunch when we were the only people in the joint.  The latter experience also featured a hi-larious interaction with the staff and our table taking turns creating a living spec for what precisely IS a hipster. 

If you find yourself - IN ANY WAY - waffling on the subject of waffles then you should probably give Starving Artist a miss. But - if you do LOVE waffles - or even consider them as a potential Food with Benefits, you will enjoy the food, atmosphere, and service of this unique spot in the west side.

My juice was expired. After apologies the server replaced it (and charged me for it!!) My eggs were left under the heat lamp so they were really dry. We had to remind the server like five times for things we were missing (napkins, sides we'd ordered...) Had to ask for the bill twice and then it wasn't itemized so we could divide the bill. Also, cash only is a pain in the ass especially when you have more than 4ppl. 

It was extremely busy, but we were first to be seated (I got there early and waited in line) and we were not the first served food. 

We'd been to this location before and had a great meal. I won't likely go back.

Super tasty food with very delicious coffee! The atmosphere is really interesting, they have a bunch of cool local art hung up with some fun music. 

We came in for brunch/lunch on a Tuesday around noon, thinking that it wouldn't be too busy. It was pretty packed, but we got seated after twenty minutes or so. Our server forgot our order so we wound up waiting for a bit longer, but that can happen to any server, especially when it's so busy. 

Def recommend, it's a really cute location with tasty food!

Figures that once I move from the apparently on-the-cusp-of-not-being-sketchy Blansdowne area, a lovely brunch nook/watering hole opens up. 

But geographical bitterness aside, this waffle-centric joint has a lot going for it, from a cool, laid-back atmosphere and interesting but unobtrusive decor to a really, really tasty potato salad and an interesting interpretation of eggs Benny. 

Despite that fact that there was no omelette on the menu, my default brunch order, I was mega stoked to discover that they offered avocado as a substitute for bacon on the 'Waffle Benny', for FREE. Stoked to the point where i may have actually let a little squeal of delight escape my lips. Substitutions always cost, if they're even offered at all, so I was rather impressed that they let me know I could go the buttery vegetable (fruit?) angle without penalty right off the bat. I'm a sucker for the details.

My brunch partner took the exact opposite view of bacon and got 'The Hitchhiker' - cheesy scrambled eggs with two mini waffles - and opted to upgrade his caramelized bacon to 'waffle bacon', a completely new concept for me wherein bacon is added to the waffle batter for a marriage of sweet and meat. Despite the fact that I generally stay away from the stuff, curiosity got the best of me, and I went in for a sample of this coated bacon creation. The verdict? The sweetness and texture of the waffle actually offset the sometimes overpowering saltiness of bacon and also helped to eliminate the excess grease factor that usually turns my stomach. Definitely worth a try.

Ok, back to my dish. The Waffle Benny came with two sides, and despite Bart's proclamation to the contrary, Starving Artist did make friends with salad, one leafy and one creamy potato salad, which satisfied my yen for a hash brown like addition to my plate. 

The poached eggs were tasty, fluffy and enjoyed a nice smattering of hollandaise sauce and having the creaminess of an avocado was a welcome addition. Although I think I prefer an English muffin to a waffle as a the little bed for my eggs Benny to rest on, I enjoyed the subtly saccharine quality the waffle brought to the brunch table, even though I usually go for strictly salty.

The coffee, while a little on the strong side for me, was still plenty good and was promptly replenished and our waitress was capable, kind and refreshingly available while not being overbearing. Being able to balance those two qualities is sometimes the difference between good and great service and I'd say she nailed it.

I will definitely be hitting up this cozy and cool brunch joint/bar again and am curious to see what it's like after dark, which will probably happen sooner than later since they have a Nacho Night. This girl likes her cheese.

I was here today with my sister. We weren't looking for anything big, (even though the waffles looked really good), but because it was so hot we just settled on a snack. Both of us ordered some juice and the fruit and yogurt bowl. Now, we were seated right across from where the cooking staff were working and had the pleasure of listening to them talk about video games, ex-girlfriends and whatever else while they took a WHOLE HOUR to prepare an order where no cooking was involved. In the meantime, they made dishes for other tables who arrived long after us (albeit, slowly) and our chit stayed posted up on the board for them to see and ignore. We were about to leave when the waitress-- who was pleasant, apologized on their behalf and offered to comp us our drinks. Of course, this was not the waitress' fault, so we told her that and ended up tipping her at the end. Eventually, our food arrived and it was very good! The selection of fruit was delicious and there was lots of variety, but honestly? I could have made it myself at home in about 5 minutes. Probably won't come here again-- I can get a good waffle pretty much anywhere else in the city.

Yummy food! I got the veggie sandwich which came with fruits and a salad for around $12. Also, got a blueberry dessert which was small in size then what I pictured. It was absolutely scrumptious but for the size, I believe the price was too high. The staff wasn't the greatest. They took a long time to come to us when there weren't many people there in the first place. Overall, I rate Starving Artist for 4 stars.

Hmmm starting at the low point because of a 45 minute wait.  But the whole menu is about re-inventing the waffle. Waffle with egg. Waffle with cheese. Should be called Bubba Gump Waffle Co.  Anyways the food is mediocre due to the fact waffles don't go with everything, Service was very slow, I'd understand if it was the first day or week but they have been at this location for a while.
Maybe its the name of the place that makes people coming but its the only good thing this place has got going for it. 
In my defense I was thinking " chefs are artists of the pallete" and that this place must have a  crazy kitchen with some real culinary madness.... I was obviously mislead. The only thing I got to leave here with the thought "I've been to the Starving Artist." Not too sure if that's a good thing.

NICE NICE NICE

Food was bomb but there was a long wait. Don't come here if you have a big group because you'll never get a table. 

The service was mediocre--nothing special. But I enjoyed my meal so I guess it was worth the wait? 

The prices are good for the serving sizes and the food didn't take long to come. It was very filling.

Overall, I would recommend this place to my friends, specifically for late breakfasts or for lunch.

delicious, but not worth the frustration. 

i will never ever NOT listen to yelp reviews EVER AGAIN. there was a huge discrepancy between this location and the original one at landsdowne, but since this one was closer, my brunch partner and i decided to try it. 

it took us 2 hours between first getting in line and to finally getting our food. i'm usually OK with a brunch wait...it's sometimes a part of the experience. but NOT when this wait to due to an inability to (a) manage staff, (b) hire staff, or (c) train staff...and this location seemed to be suffering from all of the above. the lineup was out the door, and then entire time i peeped through the window to see consistently empty tables. when we finally made it inside the venue, i asked the hostess about an empty table, "is that a real table? we're just two people". to which she responded, "it is but there are just a lot of moving parts right now". so if you read between the lines, it really means that the kitchen couldn't handle the volume. the kitchen is exposed and i saw two food cooks, one dishwasher, and one drinks person. they DEFINITELY could have used more staff. and since this is the second location by the same name, i would expect the owner/manager to have a leg-up on how to manage a restaurant by now. yes, the restaurant is spacious, but there is NO WAY that they could handle more capacity. 

our server was also very frazzled. we asked for the grilled cheese waffle with ham, to which she responded with a confused, "grilled cheese?". and my friend pointed at the menu and said, "yes the grilled cheese"- pointing directly at the menu. we also ordered drinks which didn't come. 15 minutes later, we flagged down the owner and we asked him to follow up. he came back to double-check what variety of tea i asked for. i told him, and he said that they were all out of that variety. so i settled for another. when he finally brought our drinks 20 minutes later, i double-checked with him to make sure that our food order was put in, to which he assured us that it was. 5 minutes later, we got our food. 

the food was VERY delicious. we ordered the starter of grilled cheese waffles with ham, a main of the "sammy benny" which was their take on eggs benny with smoked salmon (on waffle, of course), and a caramel pecan waffle for dessert. 

we probably should have went to the original location, but since location was its chance to reel me in, i won't be coming back. like what i said on my first line. this place is delicious, but just not worth it.

I came here with my out-of-town friend on Sunday for lunch and I am utterly appalled at the service and hygienes of this place.

Let me just get this off my chest because I was horrified after taking a sip of my almond vanilla latte - THERE WAS A DEAD BEE IN MY DRINK. 

Immersed in foam, I though it was just a piece of hair but once I fished it out with my fork, I noticed the legs... 

Okay, aside from the huge bee in my drink, there was only one server. We waited half an hour just for the menu, tables around us weren't cleared and there were flies everywhere. When she came to give us the menu, I pointed out to her there are too many flies.. And she responds with "I know" and rolls her eyes. 

If she cleared the table faster, maybe it wouldn't have attracted that many bugs. We were sitting at the cleanest table available and when she wiped it down, waffle crumbs fell into my sandals. 

As we wait for our food, three other tables left because they weren't even given menus. I had to ask for water two times and never received it.

We were seated right by the two garbage bins by the kitchen and the smell was horrid. The cook got into a heated argument with the server because he can clearly see upset customers and she cannot. 

The bee in my latte was the last straw. As I walked by the front to let the server know I was leaving, she just gives us a thumbs up sign. 

Just a note: the two other times I came during the weekend, service was significantly better and there are no flies during the winter. However, after this experience today, I will never come back..

This location sucks ass. Haven't ever eaten here but the first time we arrived at 5:31 the girl had already locked the doors and pulled out the till. She came out and said "sorry we are closed at 530." Came here the day after and it was 5pm, when we walked in there was nobody but the server gave the fakest smile because she obviously didn't want more customers coming in. She wouldn't let us sit anywhere in the restaurant except ONE particular spot because we would be "in her way". Also no where online does it say they stop serving the egg bennys after 4. Thanks to this location, I'll never be coming back to even try it.

Been wanting to check out this place for a while, and was impressed given the 3-star rating on Yelp. Possibly thanks to the -20 degree weather outside, the place wasn't too busy and we easily got a table. As another Yelper noted, perhaps some of their ingredients lean towards the prefab, but nonetheless for an indulgent waffle breakfast, was thoroughly enjoyable in taste and presentation.

Waffle-ly delicious!

I've been here a bunch of times.  

At first I was hooked... but as they boomed, the service got slower (lack of waitstaff not meeting the influx of customers), and my waffles were consistently ice cold with an unmeltable chunk of butter.

I returned a few more times and only ordered items with potato waffles because they are less icky when cold.

This place has come a long way since those cold waffle days.

This venue is still crazy cool. Artwork from local artists, the chill house tunes, the wonderful little backyard patio. The service is always friendly but busy.

They have a great menu, with savory lunch items and sweet dessert waffles.   I was starving and ordered one of the larger brunch dishes on the menu, the Hitchhiker with waffle bacon (about 10 bucks) with the dill potato salad.

My waffles were not ice cold! Not piping hot, but acceptable.
  
I still find the service quite slow, even though they have hired more staff. So, not the place to go if you are in a hurry, but great for a lazy afternoon.  

I would give the place four stars, but I have an issue with cold waffles.  And also in the summer, the bee problem does drive me crazy, but I don't know if that's actually fixable.  I just don't want to share my food with flying critters of stinging pain.

I can't say that I've ever been a big waffle fan (I tend to go for crepes or French toast), but Starving Artist may have made me a convert.  Their sandwiches with waffles instead of bread are great.  The smoked salmon sandwich with dill baked into the waffles and their BLT are particular standouts.  I wasn't as big of a fan of their chicken sandwich, which was somewhat bland.

It's a really busy brunch place.  You have to be willing to wait, which I have no problem doing.  The service is a bit hit or miss though.  The first time I went there, the service was efficient and courteous, but the second time, the waitress was quite distracted, forgetting to bring elements we had ordered and I had to wait 15-20 minutes for a refill of coffee.  But the food will definitely keep me coming back for more!

The very first time I heard about this place - in November 2012 - I insisted we go there ASAP and we went the very next weekend for brunch. There were two things I was told that made me do this: 

1) Everything - and I mean EVERYTHING - they make involves waffles (want a BLT? Have it between two waffles!)
2) They make gluten-free waffles (which are also vegan). 

Needless to say, considering I gave The Starving Artist 5 stars, it did not disappoint. Despite all the regular waffles and flour being used, I've never had an issue eating here (though I am not really sensitive to cross contamination). When you order GF, the staff ask if it's an allergy, intolerance, or preference and use that information to prepare your food correctly to the best of their ability; so kudos to them for that.

My favourite dish here is the eggs benny. As much as I LOVE traditional waffles piled high with fruit, syrup, and whipped cream; the lure of getting an eggs benny I can ACTUALLY. EAT. in a restaurant (and a damn good one at that) is too much.  Also, it has caramelized bacon on it. Yes, you read that right. They do make their eggs on the runny side (and I mean REALLY runny) so if you're not into that, make sure you ask for them done differently. It comes with mixed greens an your choice of fruit, baked beans, or potato salad. I always go for the fruit, and it's always a nice, fresh mix.

The Cherry Chocolate Latte is also to die for (and as good as it sounds). I've yet to try their famous waffle bacon, but I am sure it's every bit as awesome as it sounds (how can you go wrong with waffles and bacon?).

Just this weekend, I brought my (also gluten-intolerant) mother and sister here, and they both fell in love. We all ended up with the eggs benny (again, how can you resist a gluten-free one?!) and all three of us cleared our plates. 

Other fun things about this place include a wide selection of boardgames, a movie always playing on the big TV, an open-concept kitchen so you can watch them cook, a nice front (and back!) patio, an aquarium with HUGE gold fish, and really awesome local artwork displayed (and for sale) adorning the walls. 

The only negative thing I can say about this place is the wait - it's quite small, and as you can expect, is VERY busy, so you'll be facing a wait during brunch hours. Since the place is small, this SUCKS during the winter, but during the summer it's less of a bummer as you can wander the neighbourhood or wait outside. However, the staff are always very friendly, upfront and as accurate as can be about table wait times or food wait times (this weekend, we had to wait over 45 minutes for food after ordering but we were warned about this before we even got a table and choose to wait).

I HIGHLY recommend visiting this place if you love waffles... or hell, even if you don't. It'll convert you.

Cool place. Great service. 

Waffles are unreal here. Everytime I go there is about a 30 to 45 minute wait. But honestly it is so worth the wait. Great smoothies. Great coffee and awesome food!

Should've realized that this would be a bad experience as soon as I walked in and had to wait 20 minutes before someone asked how big my party was. The table itself and music were both fine, but then we had to wait an extra 10 minutes to order. Then an ensued an additional 30 minute wait for our actual food, which to be fair wasn't too bad. If we were going off food alone, this establishment may even warrant a 3 or 4 star review. But I think what really ground my gears was the disgraceful service our waiter "Scotty" provided us. Not even bothering to acknowledge us except to take our order and give us the check (someone else actually brought us our food, not him), Scotty gave us an awkward, cold, and overall disappointing experience. Finally, what ultimately solidified this one-star review was the fact that they only accept cash and failed to mention this in any manner (there were no signs or any other indications of this) until we tried to pay with card and were rudely told otherwise and had to use an ATM that charged us a hefty transfer fee. If you are willing to stomach this entirely embarassing experience just for the slightly above average food, then give this place a look. Otherwise, stay away - far, far away.

While it's true being seated and served can be at a casual (read: slow) pace, if you arrive at 9 am when they open, you'll get seated right away. The food is served hot, is tasty, and is a pretty good deal. Four awesome Eggs Benedict options in the $10-14 range, served on waffles (either sweet/wheat or savory/potato). The Hitchhiker is probably the best "deal" - $12 for two waffles, scrambled eggs with cheese, 4 strips of maple-glazed bacon (ask for it crispy - trust me), mixed greens, and some fresh fruit. I've eaten here four times, and have never been disappointed.
Their potato waffles are a must! I ordered the B. Benny and it was bomb! The only issue was that service is a bit slow but the food is worth it

First time here, we had the potato waffle bennys, regular waffle bennys with potato salad, fruits, and side salad.  We loved everything.  I found the potato waffles slightly salty.  Their caesar is pretty good.  The carmelized bacon is pretty good.  Will be back for waffle bennys.  Have been here 3 times.  The third time was a flop.  Waffles were undercooked, poached eggs were overcooked.  The yolk should be runny. The bacon was sickly sweet.  The baked beans were too sweet.  Asides from the fruit on our plate, everything was left uneaten after trying a taste.  We will be back because this is 1/3 visits and we hope someone was just having a bad day.

Came back for the 1st time since being away for 5 years. The waitress didn't seem to make much effort to smile or provide friendly service. Took my order and then asked me if I was ready to order only 2 minutes later. I didn't receive my coffee order had to enquire and recorder with the barista. Received coffee with my food, it went cold while I ate. Perhaps it's just a personal pet peeve of mine but it really bothered me that I said 'thanks!' a few times and didn't receive any response. 'You're welcome' or 'how is your food?' would have been nice. Also, they have a huge wasp problem. I had to move because I was being swarmed my 4 wasps the whole time. Couldn't escape them either, really annoying!

The best breakfast waffles ever! Both regular and potato waffles! I ordered the egg beni, substituted my bacon with tomato and avocado ( just ask the waitress/waiter) they'll gladly substitute any item on the menus. The dish was tasty and filling. 
The service is awesome, when we arrived and waited for our table they offered we sit on the bar till we sat on our table. 

The price is reasonable too! Will definitely be back here for brunch!

I chose this restaurant for breakfast on my last visit to Toronto just because of the Yelp reviews, and I wasn't disappointed! My salmon eggs benedict was superb. I really love the feel of the cafe itself. This is hipster central, and I'm sure you see the chefs make your meal out of sheer necessity to maximize the space, but I appreciate it anyway. There's a patio out front and in back, but still not nearly enough seats to meet the demand, so if you're strolling in anytime after 10am, be prepared to wait a bit for a table. Staff is friendly, albeit a bit rushed, but it doesn't effect the quality. This is a perfect brunch spot!

Good greasy breakfast.  Lots of waffles.  Everything is waffles, because it's a waffle place?!  Waffles here are pretty good, bacon is cooked right, not a fan of anything else though.  Got scrambled eggs which I think they forgot to scramble,    Coffee was good,  Great service and nice atmosphere.  Would come again, but only if I be craving waffles, because it's a waffle place.

We went late summer on a Saturday morning. Waffles eggs Benny for sister and myself, hitchhiker for the husband. I had the gluten free waffle which is potato, it was yummy, but the eggs Benny was underwhelming. Husband didn't want waffles, we didn't know that's literally all they have. I think you should be able to substitute with toast or something cheap and easy. The biggest problem was the bees. I am anaphylactic to bees, this was the most stressful meal of my life. There are hundreds of them, inside and out. I ate with my fork in one hand and epi-pen in the other. Won't be returning until the dead of winter when the bees are dead.

This restaurant is wonderful. I walked in with my friend at 11:30 on a Saturday. It didn't take too long to be seated - it was about a ~20 min wait. The menu options are great. They have a lot to offer. I went with the eggs benny on regular waffles (though I'd like to try the potato waffles next). The service was a little slow and it took a while to get our food, but that happens with Saturday brunch. The whole place was filled and the servers, despite the crowd, were as happy and attentive as they could be. 
The food, though. It was delicious. A perfect eggs benedict. I couldn't recommend it more. It wasn't too filling and I simply loved their flavours. 
I'll definitely be returning.

I hope this review is seen by management because my question to you is what is going on here?? The service is obviously consistently horrible here, judging by other reviews and my own experience. However the waitresses can't be blamed! This place is SO UNDERSTAFFED.

The restaurant was packed and only two people were staffed as front of house/waiting/bussing and 2 in the kitchen....nobody to greet you as soon as you walk in, water was only given to the table after asking, you're eating around tables with mountains of dirty dishes that haven't been cleared yet, and the wait for poached eggs was 30 minutes and nobody has the time to ask how your meal is. But you can only expect 2 girls to do so much with 20+ tables to serves! They were friendly but clearly out of breath from running around the place! 

In addition to that the food was just mediocre. Potato waffles are OK, regular waffles are OK, you can probably make a similar mix at home. We got the breakfast benny and it was filling but not great. I like that the fruit that comes with the food isn't cantaloupe and honeydew, but real fruit like watermelon, oranges, berries and grapefruit. 

Waitresses are friendly and the fruit was good which is why this place got 2 stars. Besides that, wouldn't go again!

Went for brunch on Sunday. Wait time was 30mins and wait time for food was 20mins. This was my second time to starving artist. Loved their original location better then this. 
The waffles were salty and the rest was just mediocre. Won't be going back for sure. Not worth the line up

Delicious potato waffles. The space is pretty and open, but the service isn't great (waited for 10 minutes one day at the door- the place was half-empty- and we weren't even acknowledged. We gave up and went down the street to Boom). The music is sometimes annoying top 40 stuff. For a less squeaky-clean, stroller-friendly atmosphere, good music and better service, try the Lansdowne location.

After seeing this place raved about on the Food Network's "You've Got to Eat Here", I finally got a chance to go. I absolutely love the feel of the place and the concept of EVERYTHING is made on or with waffles - very creative! The only downside I found to the place is that the place is CASH ONLY and it would be helpful if they shared this on their website because it was disappointing to find out right when we got inside. 
Besides that, I have to admit, it's a great place to eat. They had an "Easter" special since the long weekend was coming up and I think it's a very clever way to always keep the menu interesting!

Hip place, cool concept. Thought the food was just average (nice presentation though). I had Eggs benny with salmon and very so so. Not good enough to convince me to come back. Coffee was good though. I think what rubbed me the wrong way too was they have filled maple syrup bottles on the tables but they are only on table syrup and you have to pay $2 for maple syrup. Not such a big deal but more so a cheap hoax
I dont even know how the food is because nobody would take my order. I waited for a good long while, while being ignored.

Wandered in here thinking it was a coffeeshop and only intended to get some drinks and sit in some air conditioning for a while. 

Sat down and realised it was a full service restaurant and felt guilty, so I ordered a blueberries and ice cream dessert waffle (at 11 am, ha). It was the best thing I'd eaten in ages. Blueberry waffle covered in fresh blueberries, topped with ice cream and whipped cream and drizzled with butterscotch. The waffle was perfectly crispy and tender, and the sweet tart berries and cream were so delicious with it. 

If I lived here, this place would be my indulgence go-to spot.

it's been a while since i've been here and like i said in my last review i was more than happy to come
back.

i enjoyed my breakfast as much as i did last time, but i did notice (and agree with) the majority of the comments here.

we waited about 10 mins to get seated, when we arrived at the table the floor was covered in food that was wiped off the table and left on the floor.

my cousins seat was wet because the server must have just wiped it down. i appreciate that they're trying to get us seated asap but the cloth used to clean the table stunk and left a very bad after smell on the table.

our order was taken in a relatively quick manner and out food came out in a good time and cooked well.

i forgot that this place is cash only, they do have an ATM there; but the service fee to withdraw cash is expensive. My mocha latte was delicious and i really have no complaints about the service other than the one thing at the beginning.

Having been to the original location, I happy to finally get around to trying the newer downtown location.  This place is much bigger and open than the older one.  As others have mentioned, we also had to wait for a table.  However from the open concept, one can clearly see the tables being full and not just a result of bad service.   The staff were all fine and attentive, not sure why there are complaints about that as I was satisfied on that front.   Too bad the food that was a such a big let down.

The poached eggs were overdone to the point the yolk was solid.  The waffles from the grill cheese waffle were completely tasteless.   The side salad was nothing special and fruit side was not fresh either.  If I'm hungry and nearby the place in the future, it's debatable if I would rather starve or consume their food...coin flip situation.

Terrible service! The horrendously rude servers kept us waiting and waiting. When we enentually got seated, it took them 45 minutes to bring our brunch over and even then, they'd got the order wrong, for which not only did they not apologize but also told my friend off for having taken a bite of the food that the SERVER had just brought over by mistake!!!We'll never go back to this place!

Amazing food! I've been here 2 times and was not disappointed. I had the B-benny and waffle bacon and oh boy is it good! They make waffles made out of mashed potatoes taste like heaven. I admit it can get crowded and busy... And unfortunately it has a big hipster vibe. But that doesn't affect the taste of the food. I would definitely give this place a chance. The best time to go is during the weekdays when it first opens as it is empty.  Way better than Boom Breakfast down the street.

Good brunch spot.  I shared the grilled cheese waffles with a friend, which was great.  

I had the Sammy Benny which is eggs Benedict on a waffle with fruit as a side; I substituted for a potato waffle which was delicious.  

Great, prompt service. Came at 10 am on a Sunday and a lineup started soon after we arrived.  I would come here again.

It has taken me nearly 3 years to give a hell about brunch. Just a fancy word for breakfast in a city.

I still say that but the difference is i do make more of an effort to go to recommended brunch spots.

I was bought here first last year by two good friends, they recommended the eggs benny on potato waffles. This was on the menu for $12 so reasonable i thought.
Surprisingly enough this was my first experience of Hollandaise sauce (i had to google it just to get the spelling correct), and it caught me off guard at first and i attempted to scrape most of it off.

I came again recently and decided i would give it another tr and enjoyed it much more. Maybe having tried new things over this last year i enjoyed the sauce more.

Overall i have enjoyed the service, and especially the food. The portions are really good and i am pretty stuffed by the end of it.

The first time i came was a cold sunday morning and we were waiting in line (outside) for nearly an hour. The more recent visit was on Saturday around 11am and we were seated straight away.

The actual place is not an overly fancy setup. They have a front and rear area outside for seating and inside it is low frills.

Went last night with my brother at his recommendation, he really loves this place. It was a Tuesday night so we had no trouble getting a table and it wasn't very busy. Our waitress seemed to be having dinner with her mom, so the chef took our order, kinda random but it worked. The staff was friendly and the potato salad was delicious!! I don't know if it was just an off day, but the side of avocado I ordered wasn't ripe at all. Alcohol was decently priced, overall a nice, cozy little bar.

I had high expectations for this place but after two visits I can now say this : the food was good (gluten free waffles and the presentation is great but I felt the service was sub par and the staff can even be rude at times, the food didn't arrive at the same time and there were errors in our order both times. However the biggest insult is they tried to serve us corn syrup and pawn it off as maple... And when we asked to give us maple they said they didn't know where it was. I'm sorry but if you serve waffles... Maple syrup is a must have.

Banana milkshakes are exceptional and the main reason my review is 4 stars instead of 3. 

Food wise it's pretty good and the savoury waffle concept is a nice change from the other run of the mill brunch locations.

Is it really necessary to be cash only? I understand this decision is somehow linked to the name but the decor and prices hardly suggest the venue is aimed at low-income patrons.

Easily the worst meal I've had in city in years. The fact that they accept only cash is the canary in the coal mine for how the entire restaurant operates - as cheaply as possible with no regard for the customer. Another red flag? They have cute little maple syrup bottles on every table... filled with shitty Aunt Jemima. 

Everything was prefab, from the potato salad to the hollandaise to the waffle mix. This is seriously perplexing as it would actually be cheaper and better for everyone if this stuff was homemade, the only explanation being that the owners are not only cheap but lazy. Yet all this would be fine if they just billed themselves as a shitty breakfast spot like Overeasy - yes it's not great, but you don't have expect it to be. But no, they clothe themselves in hipster branding to give you the illusion that they actually give a shit about the product or you the customer. 

I'll save you the trouble, they don't.
The place is tiny so expect a long wait. The waffles were mediocre. Almost the same as getting freezer waffles. They weren't light and fluffy; and were small.  It's nice to have vegan options though.

2.5 STARS
I came here for a late Sunday brunch and luckily was seated immediately.  Decor is simple, rustic with local artwork displayed on the walls.  No air conditioning which made for an uncomfortable environment on a hot day and I was offered room temperature water to drink, go figure.

Ordered the B. Benny ($15) which were 2 bacon benedicts served on potato waffles.  A side salad and a few pieces of fruit as an after thought completed the plating.  I will say they do make a better than average hollandaise sauce and the potato waffles were tasty.  Other than that everything else was ho hum average.  Because of the unbearably stuffy, hot restaurant I could not get out of there fast enough.  I would assume creating a comfortable space for diners is just as important as providing good service and food.  I guess I was wrong.  Also the portion was meager & did not satisfy my hunger.  For the same price at Under The Table,  I am able to get a filling brekkie and a coffee.  In hindsight, I should have gone there instead...live and learn.
A-mazing! That place is so good, if you love waffles, then come to this place. The service was fast and it has a great atmosphere.

Took my wife here as part of a birthday weekend of brunches, not realizing, that it's a waffle house.  And I don't like waffles.  She was surprised alright!

Not only is everything waffle here, but it's also darned good.  My dish (Sammy Benny) was a touch salty, but I think that might be because of the salmon.  If so, there should be an adjustment in the other ingredients for that.  My wife had the regular Benny, and that was really good.

Based on that, we'd come back.  :)

Waffles waffles waffles! 

How could I not love this perfect little Spot. I recently went here again for my birthday lunch. My friend and I both got the chicken club waffle sammy. Why aren't all sandwiches on waffles? We both went for the side of potato salad which is also amazing. It wasn't the lightest of lunches but if you're hungry this is the spot! Also this place is great if you're gluten free.

The staff here is also really nice, The few times I have been here I always end up chatting with them before I leave. 

I have to check out the St. Clair location next!

Cute little spot. My friends and I had to wait at the bar for a friend who was late because they wouldn't seat an incomplete party. Though it was disappointing, it turned out to be the highlight of our culinary experience!

We watched the kitchen guys in action. (The kitchen is located in the middle of the restaurant.) They absolutely love their job! They joked around and were extremely efficient. They even fed us fresh fruit while we waited. It was awesome.

On to the food! Waffles! That's all I gotta say. Their traditional ones are just perfect. I had a bite of my friend's waffles. I opted for the potato waffles which I got  with "The Hitchhiker" and substituted the bacon for avocado. Potato waffles! Yes. They were as awesome as they sound. 

Though the restaurant is far from downtown, it's worth the trip. :D
Loved it here! The best eggs benedict!

Great brunch spot for Eggs Benedict.

On the weekends it gets busy and the wait could be long. We wait for about 40 mins at 11 o'clock on Sunday.

Eggs are perfectly cooked and perfect with their waffles and caramelized bacon. If your eggs aren't cooked medium, which is the default, let them know and they'll make you another set. Potato waffles (B.Benny) are waffles that taste like mashed potatoes. I usually get one with regular waffle and one with the potato waffle to share with someone. Two potato waffles are too rich for me.

Cash only.

Starving Artist located on Lansdowne just north of Bloor is an unusual eatery.  The base for all meals is waffles! Everything is served with this Belgian delicacy.  Waffle sliders, waffles with baked beans, waffle Benny, and a chicken/ bacon club on waffles!   These guys have a serious love affair with waffles.  Brian and Tobias have managed to create a fascinating waffle menu with sweet and savoury combinations that transcend typical bistro fare.    The atmosphere is super chill and inviting.  They always play good music and often have cool old school movies playing on a projector.  A variety of fun board games are available to play while you have a drink or a snack.  There is a front and back outdoor patio for those beautiful summer evenings.  They often have DJs spinning at night and occasionally live music.   The decor is pretty random, but very fun to look at.   Huge crowds of hipsters for weekend brunch, so I would advise rising a little earlier than usual if you are not too hungover to beat the crowds-supper time is far less crowded during the week.  They have reasonable prices and great people at Starving.  

I highly recommend this waffle bar!

But make um understand its Westside foe life!
Thanks so much for your time.

Came on a busy Sunday afternoon. The service was pretty good and the wait for a table and for food wasn't too bad considering how busy it was. 

I ordered an Americano and the chicken and bacon waffle and was impressed with both. It was just under $20 per person with tax and tips. I'd come back again :)

Came here a couple of days ago for a double date. Wasn't that busy and got seated in 5 minutes. The waitress was nice but the food came in 30+ minutes. I ordered the B. Benny which I thought was fairly expensive for its amount and quality. My major complaint is that the egg was hardboiled ) :

The most amazing light flavorful waffles you can imagine. And there are so many ways to have them, sweet or savory; gluten free or not--or potato.  I had the plain ones with blueberries and a touch of syrup served with a salad and maple beans.  My husband had potato with caramelized bacon and poached eggs served with salad and beautiful mixed fruit. Both meals were incredible.  It's a must if you're in the waffle mood--and would be great even if you're not.

Went at 2pm and there was no line, and space on the patio... but really, 2pm is pretty late for brunch, even for me, so that's not saying much.

Ordered the breakfast waffles, poached eggs (lovely runny yolkes) on mashed potatoes that had been crisped in the waffle iron. It was good and very filling. I also appreciated the amount of fruit that came with it. I wish there was more bacon. One because it was delicious. Two because there can never be enough bacon. 

I would definitely go back, especially if I had a sweet craving! The waffles with fruit and whipped cream looked amazing.

$16 with tax and tip for the breakfast and a tea.

Starving artist is amazing! 

I have been to the original 1st location before, however it's been closed down and 3 other locations have opened up. There's no doubt in my mind that this is the best Waffle House! 

Their waffle bacon is a must upon arrival while waiting for your meal. 

Starving artist has a wide variety or sweet and savoury waffles. 

My favourite go to meal is; B Benny (on the potato waffle). It's super filling, creamy, and delicious. 
You also get a choice of a side between bakes beans, fruit or mashed potato salad. I opted for the fruits! 

In addition to the meal, I got a vanilla almond latte. The drink was amazing! Not overly sweet, but with hints of maple sweet flavour... definitely a good start to the day!! 

The waiters were on point with the seating system. Even tho the line was fairly long, the staff made it a quick and painless waiting process. Before we knew it, we were already sitting at a table! 

Starving Artist is cash only!! Bring some cash or use the ATM they have on location. 

Aside from the food... starving artist is known for their art on the wall which made a great display, a great way to get to know the local artists, or purchase a painting for yourself. 

I highly recommend a visit to starting artist to anyone and hope to see more locations pop up.

Very disappointing. They use cold Kraft singles in the breakfast sandwich. I asked the waiter if the cheese could be melted, which he took it back to do, but reacted very defensively. Side salad had lettuce on the verge of rotting. Mount Pleasant desperately needs a better brunch place.

Cute little place that serves a great breakfast. Went with a group of 7 on Saturday afternoon brunch. Seated quickly because we arrived early but did notice that a long line was present in the restaurant the entire time we were there. All of us ordered some variation of eggs benedict and everyone enjoyed their meal.

You get a choice between potato waffles (mashed potatoes in a waffle shape) or regular waffles and both are quite good. Comes with a side of greens and your choice of fruit, beans or potato salad. Service was pleasant.

They accept cash payment only.

Had to check out the brunch. Ordered the eggs benny. The eggs were hard boiled! The fruit on the side was desiccated. The waffles (in lieu of muffins) were tasty but on the mushy side. 

Friendly service. Maybe a bit too casual at times, but I can accept that vibe.

I really enjoy coming here for their delicious breakfast and the coffee is great too.  The place feels nice inside and the decor, although old, fits the style and food they serve here.  It's hard to find a good waffle house in the GTA let alone on the west end, but this one fits the bill nicely! 

My go to meal is the Chicken bacon club or the Breakfast Benny.  The portions are almost perfect and they have a nice option for salad and fruits on the side.  The waffles are made fresh and if you're super hungry make sure to grab some waffle bacon on the side.  I've never had waffle bacon before this place and it's hard to go back!

Overall the food is great and the staff are fairly friendly and attentive.  I always like going here for a breakfast or brunch treat and I'm never disappointed.   I'll be back for more waffle bacon!

Great environment, great food, BUT BEWARE OF THE LINES AND THE WAITING TIME. My friends and I got to the restaurant at 1:30ish and we waited about 30 minutes for a table. By the time our food got here, it was around 2:30. 

The food was really AMAZING though. I got the Waffle Benny - 2 mini waffles topped with poached eggs, avocado & hollandaise sauce. It came with a side of greens and some super fresh fruit. (I substituted bacon for avocado). I was amazed at how good the food was, how fresh the fruit was. I also got a latte! 

So, good place to go eat but the waiting time is just crazy. The restaurant takes no reservations and only seats you when all members of your party gets there.
Best breakie in the west end. The potato waffles are delicious, add eggs Benedict (my case smoked salmon) and you can beat it. Must try.

Starving Artist is the Ultimate Hipster Breakfast and Im not even mad. I love everything about this place ! The food , the music , the look .The service was awesome ,loved the music. Im not a fan of chains and this is right up my alley. Very authentic and explemfies what living in the city is all about. I ate everything on my plate. Parking can be hard so either go early to park on the street  or park in a lot and walk down. I can't wait to go back again

Great food. Worst service in history of hipster service. Been coming here for years and they can't ever seem to staff the restaurant. Always making excuses that they are under staffed. Management is completely busted. Learn how to hire reliable staff. Other locations are fine. This one is completely broken.

I went to Starving Artist for brunch today after reading about it on yelp. I normally don't eat food like this so it was a special treat. It did not disappoint!
I had the breakfast benny. The potato waffle was an very nice touch.  It was creamy and smooth and made it a hearty meal. The caramelized bacon was delicious. The eggs were slightly runny, but not offensively so. Also, the presentation was beautiful. 

The ambience is not my favourite: noisy, cramped.  Plus my friend and I were sitting by the door, so there was a draft and people standing over us at all times (we went at 1 pm today, a Sunday).  But aside from that we had a lovely brunch.

I don't see myself going back here often, because I tend to stick to a healthier diet. But on special occasions, like the day before New Year's, yeah, this was perfect.

Oh yeah, there seemed to be a rush of people right after we arrived, so you may want to go earlier to avoid lineups etc.
I can't say what it's like before 1pm, but I can tell you this: we sat in the last available table and our food came out promptly.

We came to this place for lunch and despite the 15-20 min wait in line, it was well worth it. We got the salmon eggs benedict - Absolutely spectacular. The mix of flavours cooked into this dish was top notch, the Hollandaise sauce smelled and tasted like heaven multiplied by 2 no lie. Anyways, all the customers seemed happy and we understood why. Great place to check out, I'd definitely go again!

My cousin was raving about this chain as one of Toronto's best brunch spots. So I had my first go at "starving Artist". The lineup was 15 mins before we got seated. The place was full for a 11 am spot, and a cash only place ( ATM on site-around a 1.50$ withdrawal fee according to my cousin-not bad). We got seated in the back near the bathroom area. I was happy and upset at the same time: Happy that I got to take some great shots capturing the chefs at work; upset because every few mins there were people waking by - the beautiful graffiti art can only distract me so much. 

We asked the waiter to move us to another empty for 2, but the waiter said it was reserved for 3 ppl and they brought in an extra chair for the person in the middle of the walkway. If made no sense considering the table we wanted to give up had way more space. So a straight no was our answer. 

I ordered a Bloody Caesar for 8.50$ that was very spicy that I couldn't finish it. My highlight was my main meal the Sammy Benny -17$: the eggs Benedict were truly perfect, sitting on two miniature waffles that were  equal amounts of sweet and savoury. I really enjoyed the potato salad. This meal was large and good to share. I was stuffed.

A good brunch spot for a fairly reasonable price range- needs work on customer service area.

Oh. My. God. How am I only discovering this place now? Waffles on every dish?? Oh man, talk about brunch heaven. Went on a Saturday around 11:30am, pretty prime time I'd say, and got a table within 2 minutes. Both myself and my boyfriend got the waffle benny, and it was SO good. Perfectly poached egg, sweet caramelized bacon, and hollandaise sauce on top of a waffle. Wow. And as a side I picked the potato salad, and although it was not the most brunch-like side to pick, it was probably the best potato salad I have ever had. I'm getting hungry again just thinking about it...

The waitress was super friendly and attentive too. So glad I found this gem thanks to Yelp! :)

The food was great and creative, something you'd expect from a place called starving artist.

They had a waffle twist to classic breakfast meals that works. Eggs Benny was one I had to try and it didn't disappoint. Had that with a Caesar that was really good as well.
3 levels of spicy on the Caesar and I took the hottest.... It was spicy.

My fianc√© and I came here during the week on a rainy day. We've always wanted to try it, and let me tell you it was worth it. The staff is very friendly and sat us down immediately, it wasn't too busy but enough for a rainy week day. I ordered the breakfast waffle with a side salads. The waffle was extremely tasty but too much food for me. Definitely recommend it! My fianc√© ordered breakfast Benny. She too enjoyed it, but found that regular bacon should be offered as there's too many flavours with all the different styles. Lastly, she had spicy Caesar (too spicy) to drink and I ordered the caffe lat√© (yum).

All in all I found that this place is very unique in what the offer and you can guarantee that you will not leave hungry. I can see this place being great on a sunny summers morning!
While the food is great and the reason we come back, the wait can sometimes be longer than an hour and a half on the weekends at brunch-time. This can, unsurprisingly, be INCREDIBLY frustrating.

Hmm. What to say about this place. Waited too long to get seated, waited even longer for our food. Saw lots of people wait forever for food. Once food came, only one dish came out at a time. We even saw couples get turned down from empty tables claiming "the kitchen is too behind." Food was good, but service was unacceptable to the point where we had to say something and they took care of the bill. Will not be coming back.
Decided to finally try this place and I'm glad I did. Some of the best eggs benny EVER.

i don't get why this place is only averaging 2.5 starts while I write this review.  I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here.  I was with my wife and our baby and the staff was very accommodating and actually chose a perfect table for us where we could fit our stroller.  The food came out quickly enough and it tasted great.  We shared two plates, i think it was called the benny d and the one with wafflles made of potato. The coffee was not bad, I do wished however the server would have came around to top up my coffee.

we had to wait about 25 minutes, so not too bad.  It had a nice vibe as well.

we don't live in the area, but we'll definitely be back!

Just grabbed lunch with a friend. 

Ordered plain waffles - they come with mixed greens plus your choice of beans, fruit and some other options, I chose fruit. 

All was fresh and delicious, as expected.

Grabbed peppermint tea to drink. I'm not usually a fan but this was good.  

Server was patient, friendly and attentive. 

Pricing is good, portions are large. 

Atmosphere is laid back. :)

This was the worst dining experience I have had in recent memory. Here we go.

The Hubster and I come here for a late holiday Monday brunch. We go in and see a bunch of people sitting in the little coffee shop area up front. I get the attention of the server behind the counter and ask for a table of two. She asks for my name and writes it on a piece of paper. I say "Oh, is there a wait?" and she says no. The server goes to seat a family that came in before us and disappears for about 10 minutes, so we sit in the coffee shop area, not waiting, apparently. This is not a good start, as I am incredibly hungry.

Some big issues with the place:
- the servers don't know their menu. For a place with gluten/dairy free options and a small menu, they seem to be pretty unaware about whether items do or do not have dairy.
- No coffee, just (non-refill) americanos. If there's anything that might qualify as Canadian food, it's breakfast. And breakfast = bottomless coffee.
- Small stuff, like dropping a bottle of water at the table without glasses, and coffee without a spoon. Am I being nitpicky? Yes. But that's because...
- We waited about 45 minutes from when we walked in the door to getting our food. That's way too long for waffles, eggs and bacon in a dining room that maybe seats 50. In fact, we waited a very long time to order or get anything else. That left ample time for us to look around at the half dozen tables not being bussed, the impatient people in the waiting area and all the other borderline upset looking diners and nitpick at every damn thing.

All these things I can actually forgive if the food is good. Well it wasn't. I ordered the brunchwich with the vegan waffles. An overcooked egg, a slice and a half of skinny bacon between two palm-sized waffles that could only be described as violently bland. It came with a side of potato salad that was obviously bought by the tub. I know this because my parents love Costco. The Hubster had the same thing but with all the dairy options (regular waffles, cheese, secret sauce). He was also disappointed with his meal. 

Listen, if you have a place that has waffle paintings all over the walls and brags about how everything on the menu comes on, under or between waffles, the waffles have to be incredible. Even the vegan ones. Your bread and butter has to taste better than bread and butter. If you have a whole section of your menu devoted to eggs benedict, it behooves you to make your hollandaise from scratch. And if you have the audacity to serve potato salad at all, it better be from scratch because it is the cheapest, easiest thing to make from scratch. I know this because I go to a lot of pot lucks and potato salad is what I do when I'm being cheap and lazy.

The whole experience from start to end just smacked of poor effort. Starving Artist on St. Clair West, you have made my black list.

This place is awesome! There is so much from the menu to choose from. Lots of bacon, chicken and turkey options; sweet and savoury waffles. My favourite was the waffles made with potatoes. 

I went back on a busy Saturday brunch time. The waitress was nice to us and didn't take too long for the food to come. You can tell this place is a busy one as there was a huge line forming to get into the restaurant. 

Just beware that if you're not in the mood for waffles, this is not where you go.

I love brunch and make a point of trying new places anywhere I travel. Starving Artist is a unique and very ingesting take on brunch which I really enjoy. First, the atmosphere: embodies how a "starving artist" wold decorate a restaurant, from the wall projections playing scooby-doo (or some old black and white movie) to the board games scattered about...feels more like you're in someone's house than in a public restaurant. Staff are really friendly -every one of them hipster to the core, server by day and seemingly rockstar/painter or author by night. The food is equally as inspiring with waffles liberally subing-in for what would usually be breat or toast. The candied bacon and potato waffles are to die for. Place gets rammed on week ends so go before 10am or be prepared to wait. Overall, a great option if you're open to trying a new brunch experience.

Came here on Saturday at around 1pm, had a bit of a wait but that is to be expected for waffles.
Because, you know, waffles.

The servers were quite lovely and tried their best to be accommodating towards everyone. Little things like informing waiting customers how long the wait would be and serving water are pretty basic, but so many other places don't do that, so for that thank you servers.

Other than that I had a pretty horrible experience there.
We ordered coffees and were not given any spoons. 

The music, oh my god the music, it was loud AF deep house beats. It was a terrible choice for a brunch setting, it would of been suited more towards an after hours. 

On to the food! it was overly sweet, I ordered an eggs benny with potato waffles, and holy moly, why was everything on this dish so sweet? even the side of potato salad was laced with a butt load of sugar. I couldn't finish my meal. I must say though, that who ever cooked my poached eggs knew what they were doing, the eggs were perfect, everything else not so much.

On top of all this, everything took a long time. Coffees came in about 15 minutes after we've ordered and food took approximately 30/35 minutes.

Again, they might of been under staffed that day but I still would not recommend.

Awesome place that opened very recently (June 2009). On the site of an another restaurant, it has the open airy feel of a cool cafe though it's in the middle of an old industrial area.

I know of it because I work in the area. And like school letting out for children at the end of the summer, every lunchtime one can observe a ravenous pack of my coworkers roaming the area of Lansdowne and Bloor, looking for anything edible. 

Until Starving Artist, the breakfast/lunch choices in the area were dismal.
