We were handed menus while we waited so we could decide what to eat. Holy Hanna, their menu is a waffle-lover's dream come true! I should've taken a photo, but I was too excited. 

The staff are very quick to clear and clean tables to minimize wait time, which is great. We were seated within 10 minutes of arriving, and noticed shortly after, that people starting coming in and the small waiting area filled up quickly. Good timing on our part! 

I desperately wanted coffee, which they offer, but only espresso drinks (americano, latte, etc) so this is the reason I couldn't give five stars. Maybe petty, but I usually like to have two or three cups of coffee with my brunch. I ordered an americano and it was really good, but the coffee cup was VERY small. I would not be ordering a second cup at $3 a shot. My friend ordered a strawberry banana smoothie and said it was delicious. Decent size, but I didn't pay attention to the cost. 

Our food arrived within 10 minutes or so from ordering and I was in heaven!! My, oh my. I ordered the Eggs Benedict on potato waffles, which look like mini waffles but are made from mashed potatoes. They were topped with caramelized bacon and perfectly poached soft eggs and the most delicious hollandaise sauce I've ever had. On the side, I had fresh fruit and some mixed greens. The greens could've been treated differently, maybe a citrus vinaigrette or something as they were a tad boring, but most people don't care about greens. The fruit was a nice mix of orange, grapefruit, pineapple and berries. But the star of my plate was the eggs benny. Wow. I'm still thinking about how good it was, 24 hours later. Maybe I'll go back today for another helping. I'll be sure to have some coffee first ;)

Soul Food shut down, and has been replaced by this excellent waffle shop. Just North of Bloor on Lansdowne, next to a bunch of houses.  The shop is easy to miss if you aren't from the area. Starving Artist has both a front and backyard patio, and a fair amount of space inside. It's a nicely done up space. They serve up waffles in all sorts of ways. There are savory breakfast waffles, served with eggs benedict. There are sandwich waffles (smoked salmon for the win). And then there are desert waffles, which you can get topped with just about anything. The prices are great, and the waffles are awesome.

Came here with 3 other people mid-afternoon on a weekday.  This restaurant is quite large, with a lot of seating, but considering the time of day there were only a handful of people.  

The sign at the front said to please wait to be seated.  We waited, but no one came, so the woman behind the counter said we could seat ourselves as the hostess would be a minute.  We sat down.  No one came to give us menus, so someone from our party went up to the counter to get them.  

Someone had come in just before us and was having similar issues with slow service and called the woman behind the counter (I think she was the cook) over.  She said that the waitress would be back in a minute (it had been much longer than a minute).  We were ready to order, and somewhat in a hurry, so I waived at the woman behind the counter and said "excuse me" and her reply was a "hissss" as she walked away. 
 I was really surprised.  

I got the plain waffles with fresh fruit.  They were good, but I could make them at home.  Wouldn't come back here.  Especially after seeing the reviews about poor service from other Yelpers as well.

A group of 4 of us went there on Sunday and had to wait probably 30 minutes (I expected this.) What bothers me is the quality of the food. I ordered the Hitch-hiker which is described as "Cheesy scrambled eggs, 4 pieces of bacon, 2 mini waffles." The eggs do not come as you picture scrambled eggs. They come as two pieces of cooked egg with a piece of processed cheese in between; Completely dried out and tasteless. As well, the two mini waffles were tasteless. For a place that puts EVERYTHING on, in-between or beside waffles, you'd think that the waffles would be amazing, nope, they're not. Personally, I will never return. My husband makes way better eggs.
On top of the disappointing food, at the end we learned that they only take cash! Who does that in 2016??? Some kind of artist is making out there, but rest assured, they are not starving.

Okay, fair warning to you. During the weekends there is a line. The question is - is it worth the wait? Yes, it is but bring your own coffee before you go. Because seriously it's better than what they serve.

As for the drink you could order once you arrive and found a coveted spot - the vanilla almond latte is da bomb. Our only disappointment wasthe americano and have to say, it was way too strong and served in too small a cup to adjust it to something Either of us could enjoy. The latte made up for  it though.

The food was fantastic! I ordered the hitchhiker - I  was in heaven. Everything on my plate was so good. I can't wait to go back. The potato salad I chose as the side was such a surprising delight. Yummers.

Customer service, spot on, even as we lingered for hours catching up over our lattes.

Can't wait to watch this place go out of business! We walked in at opening, not a single customer in the restaurant. They refused to seat us - a party of 12 - because "only" 10 people had arrived. The remaining two were coming from the east end, in a snowstorm (and one of them was a baby!). Again, the restaurant was completely empty. "We have a policy", they said, loudly and rudely. Great, good luck with that. We walked out, went up the street to BOOM, which was happy to accommodate us and lovely. Walked past Starving Artist again an hour and some later - still empty.

This place has some of the best eggs bennies and what makes it unique is their potato waffles. Would definitely recommend this since waffles is their specialty. Service is not the best though, they always seem a bit disorganized when you're waiting for a table and not the most efficient. Being said, this is still an excellent weekend brunch spot!

Cute place! I'm a fan. 

Came here with my boyfriend. I had a Breakfast Benny which was absolutely incredible. They make waffles out of potatoes for the base and it was just amazing. We had an order of waffle bacon (yes, waffles with bacon inside) as well which was delightful. I don't even like waffles. 

I was a bit disappointed their blender wasn't working because I was craving a milkshake, but oh well. Next time! 

Also, if you are terrified of bees, I would not recommend this place. It wasn't too bad, but there were a few buzzing around.

I was first drawn to Starving Artist as a brunch place because the initial review I read said this placed specialized in waffles. When my brunch team and I got there, we were pleasantly surprised to find EVERYTHING on the menu made of waffles. The biggest creativity item on the menu is waffled bacon. That's right, I said waffled bacon. It is bacon, covered in waffle batter, placed in a waffle maker, cut into strips and then served with a side of maple syrup for dipping. The brunch menu ranges from waffle grilled cheese, to potato waffles, regular waffles, waffles benny and more. They serve lunch, dinner and dessert (a big list of waffles/toppings) and have vegan options and a big drink list. Waffles come with a choice of two sides (options are fruit salad, potatos, beans and greens).  The tea, was disappointing because it was a regular bag of Lipton. The coffee and lattes looked better. Coffee comes in a French press. 

For someone schlepping from the nose bleed section of North York, Starving Artists was a bit of a hike but one that I would gladly drive back next time I"m craving waffles. The staff were on top of our table the entire time, despite having to rush back and forth to service the packed brunch house.   If I remember correctly, Starving Artists is a cash only/debit only place.

Weekend vibes at this hipster brunch joint. Everything waffles is the name of the game. We ordered the traditional eggs Benny and smoked salmon Benny so we could compare the regular waffle and potato waffle. Both were delicious, although I was partial to the potato waffles since they were different and went well with the savoury dish. Cash only!
Very busy spot.. long line up in the morning.. good food..everything waffles.. yummylicious!!! Servers are that friendly and accommodating though

Got here around 11:30 on a Sunday, which I already knew was a mistake. Had to wait in a line outside in the cold. Finally got inside probably half an hour later.

Server took our drink orders really fast. Drinks came out in a timely manner. I got a hot chocolate for $3.50 and paid the extra .25 to have it made with almond milk. Could've been "chocolaty-er" but maybe it was the almond milk that took over. Orders were placed and we waited...40 minutes for our food to come out. Jeez.

Anyways, food was ok. I got the waffles with peanut butter as a "topping". It actually comes on the side. The peanut butter is a whopping extra $2, which really, I could've just brought in my own packet, so I don't know what I was thinking. Defs not worth it. Waffles were good. Fluffy and crispy in the right spots. Salad and fruit were a good touch. Would I come back? If I happen to walk by and there isn't a line, sure. But I wouldn't go out of my way for this place. However, my friend that got the Sammy Benny said it was excellent. She killed her plate. They even let her do one potato waffle and one plain waffle.

Nice spot on Lansdowne ave. Always busy for brunch, expect to wait a while to be seated. Food was great, big portions at a reasonable price. Only problem is music is way too loud and server was not too friendly. Otherwise a nice place to eat but wouldn't be rushing back in a heartbeat!

No matter how good the food is, it shouldn't take 45 minutes for it to be served. I told the waitress when it hit the 30 minute mark that we have to leave in time for class. She said our food was the next to be served and we still had to wait another 15 minutes. Not only did the waitress not make it priority to serve us first (other tables who came after us were all served their food, and some even finished and left), but she just continued chatting with her co-worker while we sat there waiting. It was two orders of waffles, it should not take this long. I was so disappointed, never going back here again.

If you're going to experiment with food (eggs benny on a waffle), it better taste darn good. Unfortunately, this place did not meet live up to it. Overcooked eggs. Mushy waffles. The only good thing was the coffee. Although we did ask for coffee and was presented with an Americano (which I understand is still coffee but not the norm here).

Service was decent, but the food was not worth the wait.

Try this place if you're the really adventurous type that doesn't mind taking one for the team. Stay away if you're looking for a reliable, tasty brunch.

Must visit for waffle fans. Had the eggs benedict on potato waffle. Instant food coma. It was delicious and filling. Outside of that, they don't offer much in terms of variety but it's a great brunch spot nonetheless.

Posted pics of my meal. Very colorful. Presentation was very nice, but have had better breakfast with more taste to the eggs, but I'm picky with my eggs. Asked for a side of hollandaise sauce which helped the cheese eggs. 

Waffles and syrup were good. Hubby loved the bacon. They had a nice maple flavor. 

Never thought to add mixed greens salad with breakfast. Will adopted for breakfast I make at home! 

Sat in front of the 2 chefs that worked really well together. A lot of people were getting the eggs Benedict. Think they were called Benny's. 

Sure their coffee would be nice. Buuuuut I brought my own instant old town white coffee. They provided hot water and cream...and didn't ask any questions. 

Venue is small with outside seating in front and I think the back. People do wait in line to eat there. Peek ahead if just 1-2 of you to be seated at the bar. Don't just wait in line until your turn. 

Wouldn't go again, but glad we tried it out. 

Enjoy!

Bleh -- service is not good for this waffle joint.

Let's face it - most breakfast places are pretty big rip-offs -- the price you're paying is basically for service, when you're too lazy in the morning to cook.  There's nearly nothing on most breakfast menus that you can't make yourself.

We came early afternoon and the place was practically empty.  But service was still surprisingly slow and our server was no where to be found after they dropped off our plates.  They neglected to give us syrup and took us about 10 minutes before we flagged another server down to get syrup... for fucking waffles.

I ordered the spicy chicken waffle sandwich.  It was not spicy at all and it was just sliced chicken meat between two waffles - which made the waffles soggy.  Was not good.  The lady ordered the blueberry waffles -- which were regular waffles and they put some blueberries on top... the fucken audacity.

Do you remember that scene in 'Casino' when Sam Rothstein (Robert DeNiro) blasts the kitchen staff for inconsistent distribution of blueberries and demands that they put an *EQUAL* amount of blueberries in each muffin?  I don't even know what to say when your blueberry waffles doesn't even contain blueberries.  My inner Rothstein wanted to go to the kitchen with a hammer and ask the chef which hand they used to sprinkle blueberries on top of the waffles...

It's kitschy and it does seem to be a popular spot - for reasons I cannot understand.

If you are craving waffles, you might as well go to a place that serves everything either on a waffle, between waffles or pressed into the waffle batter. We started with a plate of waffle bacon for the table. You get four sticks of waffles, each with a strip of bacon encased inside the batter. The table consensus was that there was too much waffle vs bacon ratio, will probably skip that next time. 

I got the Monte Cristo, a large sandwich of ham and turkey but with the buns replaced by waffles. Half the fun was drowning the whole thing in syrup. It was definitely too much food for one person (had to take a half the sandwich to go) but it was a delicious challenge. A pleasant surprise was the B Benny, which came on waffles made of mashed potatoes! Will order that next time instead.

The service is good, but once it gets busy the place becomes slightly chaotic. There is one waitress, one barista and the kitchen staff for the whole restaurant. Our waffle bacon came without any separate plates to eat with, so we ended up juggling syrup on the waffles until our mains arrived. Also, try to come early. Once it hits noon, there will be long line up.

Great place.  However beware of long lineups on the weekends.  Then when you finally sit down, another long wait.  Food is pretty good when it comes.  Service is friendly.  Great ambiance if you like noisy and crowded places. Cash only.
Great service and delicious food. Despite being understaffed, the staff made sure we were comfortable and served. Recommend the potato waffles!

Having been to the Lansdowne location and loved it, I found the S. Clair location a bit of a letdown. I opted for the Hitchhiker. Cheesy eggs, caramelized bacon, 2 waffles, a side salad and baked beans or potato salad. 

Aside from the beans, my food was luke warm, with the bacon being downright cold. 

The price was right $11 and it was a lot of food, but over all I was disappointed, particularly given the line up.

Went for brunch with my parents and we loved the potato waffles Benedict. However, a few 'suggestions': they closest thing they have to regular coffee is an americano which is served in a tiny cup so basically it's an espresso. Our waitress also got most of our orders slightly wrong. Kind of annoying that they only accept cash... c'mon this is 2017!

I just had my very first brunch experience at Starving Artist. It was a nice change from the toast & potatoes diner standard I am inclined to. I especially liked their americano and combination "Waffle Bacon", both were excellently executed using quality ingredients. 

My expectations were met and I can certainly appreciate a good waffle and syrup replacing my ketchup and hot sauce smothered breakfast 'hash' any day. I swear I didn't see a ketchup or hot sauce bottle in sight! It was a nice treat, but with its rich and heavy eats, small interior and lineups, SA is a gem for those special brunch occasions.
Delicious food. The menu was simple and easy to read but the wait for the food was quite long. Downside- cash only

Yum  :) I like this place a lot. We came here on a Sunday at 11am with three people and only had to wait 15min, which is pretty good for a popular brunch spot.  

Pleasant service and all of us were happy with our meals. We had the Potato waffles and they were unique and tasty. If you like mashed potatoes and hashbrowns--it was kind like a combination of those two things.

I should probably mention this first: do not eat here! My friend and I decided to go for brunch at this location as it was closeby. It's a much smaller joint and also very dirty.

We arrived around 1:10 and there were about 4 parties in line ahead of us. We didn't get seated until around 1:40. There were tables that needed cleaning and empty ones on the patio that the servers didn't bother cleaning.

We finally got sat at a table that was all the way in the back of the restaurant and the table was clearly still dirty and not wiped down. Instead, we asked to be seated on the patio. 

Here's my biggest complaint: the level of sh** these guys give. There's no organization, no level of real service or care. The server took another table's order first when they were sat after us even though we were ready to order.

On to the food: my friend ordered the Sammy Benny and I the B Benny, eggs benedict with bacon on a potato waffle w/ salad and fruit. It arrived hot and to temperature; that was about the only positive thing about this whole experience. The eggs Benny had pieces of egg shells in it, and the bacon was soggy. I probably finished only half of my meal, and had to get up to ask for maple syrup when other tables were provided with condiments upon seating. At no point did the server come by to refill water or provide us with napkins.

This was honestly the most disappointing meal I've had in a long time. To sum it all up, they just simply don't care. 

Spend your money elsewhere! You've been warned.

Not terrible, but not the best. We arrived for brunch on a Saturday morning around 9:30 AM, and there was a decent amount of seating left. 

First, parking. We found free parking on a residential street about 2 minutes away from the restaurant. There's also street parking available, so parking wasn't too difficult to find overall.

Second, the food. Overall, it was a hit or miss for us. They have a pretty diverse menu with one common factor: waffles. You can get sweet waffles, or savoury waffles, or plain waffles - there's a lot to choose from. I appreciated the number of options and it took awhile to settle on what we wanted. We ended up ordering the B. Benny (2 potato waffles topped with poached eggs & caramelized bacon & hollandaise sauce), and the Chicken Bacon Waffles (Chicken, bacon, cheese, cucumber & secret sauce). I didn't like the Chicken Bacon Waffles at all - they were basically two plain waffles sandwiching very rubbery chicken, and very strange flavours. It was very bland, and wasn't tasty. The B. Benny, on the other hand, was quite delicious! They're basically potatoes shaped into waffles, seasoned well, and quite delicious.

Overall, the experience was just okay for us. The cutlery could have been cleaner, but service was fine, atmosphere was casual and relaxing, portion size was decent. It isn't our first choice in the area, but it's a spot you should try at least once!

I've been eating at Starving Artist ever since their first location opened on Lansdowne Ave. Regardless of which location I visit, the staff is friendly, the vibe is chill and the food is delicious! As soon as I enter the door, the smell of fresh waffles hits me and I salivate immediately. To eat, I love the Waffle Benny, Sammy Benny, Smoked Salmon, and Chicken Bacon (tastes great both with bacon or avocado). To drink, I love the rooibos tea, chai latte, cappuccino, almond latte, vanilla almond latte. I'm so thrilled to see them expanding and I love that every location reminds me of the original spot where I feel in love with their savoury and sweet waffles!
I was going to give this place 4 stars..... And then I found the board game section... Amazing lattes (recommend the marshmellow lattes)

Was excited to try this place.... it was a terrible disappointment. I had the salmon "Sammy" benny and my boyfriend had the "b.benny" (breakfast Benedict).... both were all wrong... 
a) the hollandaise sauce tastes sour and is not lovely and thick, it is very sad 
b) both of our eggs, when you cut into them, no lovely yellow goo - they were like hard boiled eggs inside! The yolk was almost tacky - gross
c) the actual white of the egg was rubbery and in large ratio in proportion to the yolk which was odd... like eating a terrible egg not even from this planet 
d) waffles - not CRISPY c'mon!!! 
e) potato waffle - not crispy either just a mushy mesh 
f) server did not even come by to see if we were enjoying our food - if she had have come by, I would have expressed my displeasure immediately. 
g) bad maple beans, way too sweet 
h) smoked salmon tasted like rotting fish and also looked the part - could not eat 

In conclusion, too much money for BAD food, no AC and subpar service.

This is a great space with ok food. I ordered scrambled eggs and mini waffles. It came with bacon and a mix green salad. The eggs came as an omlet (ummm ok?) and were burnt. The waffles were ok, they seemed kind of stale and were cold. The bacon was really good and the salad looked so underwhelming, neither my friend or I ate it. 

The best part of the experience was the latte I ordered and the fact that we were sitting in the sun. The staff is very friendly, but the food is definitely underwhelming and I probably won't go back.

I thoroughly enjoy the food at Starving Artist so that's why my review is 2 stars instead of 1. But the ppl who run it are definitely 1 star. 

Now they always have a line, that's to be expected and for good food anywhere I don't mind waiting...but the last time we were in there, the line was very long and there were about 4 tables that were free, they just weren't being cleared. 
Not only did that suck for the ppl in line but it was pretty gross for the ppl already seated to just leave dirty dishes on a table. 
Maybe they were short staffed, sh*t happens, but that's a show of how professional and well managed they actually are (not). On top of that, when we were finally seated, it took forever for a server to actually come to us and take our drink orders. Again, I realize when places are busy things fall through the cracks, but there wasn't even a "sorry for the wait" or anything. A little niceness goes a long way in these situations. 

Most recently I tried to order over the phone for pick up, and I was told by whoever answered that they aren't taking any orders because the kitchen is too busy so call back in 1/2 an hour. Isn't that the equivalent of turning people away at the door?? (Maybe that's why the tables weren't cleared, to buy the kitchen some time to catch up). 

Either way, the food is good but the management/staff running the show are awful. Hopefully they fix that problem!

I'm not usually crazy about waffles - I solidly fall on the pancakes are greater than waffles side of the fence, however, Starving Artist makes me question my love for all other carbs. Bread, English Muffins, Buns, Paninis, Bagels, Pizza Dough - don't need'em! I'm just going to eat everything on a waffle now.

Hehe, if only :P.

Anyway, this little gem just steps away from Lansdowne station specializes in, you guessed it, waffles! 

I find the service to always be good & attentive here, but like with most places in the downtown area, if you come during peak brunch hours, you are in for a wait. In a party of two I haven't had to wait more than about 15 minutes, and with a party of 4 I have generally waited about 45 minutes each time. What I see them do a lot is when someone orders a smoothie, they make extra and offer it to the people waiting for tables!

Starving Artist has a pretty cool vibe. The walls have lots of comic book art (with prices listed below in case you are interested in buying some), and I'm sort of a geek for stuff like that, so big points in my book for that! There's always a movie playing in the back (last time it was Rango), and there's tons of board games if you want to liven up your experience (recommended for non-brunch hours when the place isn't packed.)

I've been here a few times but these dishes rank among my favourites:

Waffle Benny: Who doesn't like a good eggs benny?! Now picture that delicious eggs benny but served on a fluffy, moist waffle with caramelized bacon (which can be substituted for some fresh, giant, avocado slices.) Recipe for success!

Monte Cristo: LOTS of roasted ham and mozzarella sandwiched in french toast waffles. Yep, you read that correctly, french toast waffles. I am a lover of all things french toast, so this was the first thing I ever tried at Starving Artist. It left a delicious and great impression! Try it with maple syrup!

They do have the infamous "waffle bacon" here - which is bacon dipped in waffle batter then pressed in the waffle iron, however, I'm not really sold on it. I find it's too much waffle & not enough bacon, so the bacon kind of gets lost in the waffle.

They also have GIGANTIC and yummy smoothies - I can never finish one on my own (in fact I'm lucky to down a quarter of one), so I always split one with a dining companion. If you ask they are more than happy to split it into two glasses.

I always have a good experience here, and I will definitely be returning again. Highly recommended!

I would have reviewed the food if i ate there but due to them being short staffed we couldn't be seated for another 20 mins because thats when the server would have time to clear the table. Another family ended up seating themselves and clearing their own table which i found odd. The server was very unapologetic and clearly doesn't care when people walk out. If that was my business i would have enough staff to cover the place especially a busy time  like this. It was quite the disappointment and just because of that experience i will not go back nor will i recommend this place. There are tons of places in the city that operate professionally and value their patrons, clearly this place does not.

This restaurant is a complete disaster. Very disorganized. Always under-staffed so the waiters and chefs project negative energy into the place. Our coffees didn't come out until after the food, about 20 mins after ordering... I'm pretty sure our server went out back to cry at one point because you could tell she was about to break down from the stress and constant complaints from her customers and co-workers. AND the owner is too cheap to accept debit or credit. Come on, it's 2017 and our generation is extremely inconvenienced by cash. It's all too bad, because the food is actually quite delicious, but the overall experience is enough to keep me from going back or ever recommending this place to anyone. A shame...

After debating between here and Emma's Country Kitchen, we opted to go here due to the hour wait at Emma's.

We arrived at 1:50 pm EST and it took around 25 minutes after to get our food ordered.

It took almost an hour after that to get our food.
The food itself was pretty delicious (maybe I was just so hungry at this point). I ordered the B. Benny meal which my friend mentioned tasted way better than their chicken waffle sandwich. 

However, like others have pointed out the service leaves a lot to be desired.

I am unsure if it's due to being understaffed or if the kitchen needs to speed up cook time. It was a very poor experience and this definitely needs to change as this place has decent food. 

The waffle everything concept is unique though and our server gave us complimentary drinks for being patient which was nice.

One last note, it's cash only which is kind of annoying to be frank.

Super good, the only downside was the wait. It wouldn't have been pretty in high winter, but it was decent enough.  Place is packed, but not the point of you're elbow to elbow. But two big partys of 10 people will cause a backlog if anything.

What to eat here?  This place is famous for their waffles; waffle sandwiches; waffle bacon; different kinds of dessert waffles.

I ordered their smoked salmon waffle, which comes with capers, cream cheese on a dill waffle. It was excellent, lots of smoked salmon, and not has heavy handed with the cream cheese; kinda wished I had more capers. But overall nicely balanced.

Dessert waffles were great, try their apple one, which was probably the favorite for our party, but I love their blackberry and pear one, which isn't for everyone. 

Waffle bacon was interesting, essentially it was a waffle with strips of bacon in it. They provide maple syrup as a dipping sauce. Overall impresson, good but felt a bit gimmicky.

Service was friendly and patient, despite being packed.

Absolutely amazing!

Yes this is the place that blew my socks off with their salmon eggs benny. The Benny was perfectly poached and the hollandaise sauce was delightful. This was the dish which inspired me and my gf to attempt our own eggs benny and let me tell you right now: making your own hollandaise sauce is a nightmare.

The star of the dish for me wasn't only the salmon eggs benny but the potato salad on the side. Ive never expected much from a potato salad but it had a nice tangy yet herby taste to it. I wish I'd know what was inside cause it was just so good. 

Finally we had a dessert waffle called Let's Split (?) - it was pretty standard but we will be trying other dishes next time for sure. 

Great prices. Fair portions and clean environment. Would come again if it wasnt so far away!

So first of all...you have to get waffles. Seriously You have no choice. I thought they'd have a couple non waffles options but nope. Seriously. Everything is based on waffles. I think they was some waffle in my coffee. 

The off thing is the waffles we had weren't great. Soggy for sure but also oddly sour and unpleasant. 

Also bee warned. Wasp city. It's a bit of an annoying thing outside. Not their fault but it's a thing. 

Nice staff. Cute place but the good wasn't so good. Not a return trip kind of thing.

I came on a Thursday for lunch and I was pleasantly surprised. My friend brought me here and I have no idea what to think. I love waffles so I was very happy!

Staff: Very friendly, seated quickly. Food came quickly. We actually had two servers helping us, but it may have had to do with it being a Thursday.

Ambience: I really like the d√©cor. Of course, I have a soft spot for hard lofts and the style of the place reminded me of a hard loft. With their exposed brick and open concept, I started to dream about living somewhere that looked like Starving Artist.

Food: I had the Monte Cristo which was ham, turkey and havarti on french toast waffles. It was really yummy. It was already sweet enough for me so I didn't have to add more syrup. I had mixed greens and potato salad on the side, so by the end of it I was so full!

Two thumbs up!

Every time I come to Toronto I come here. This is by far my favorite place to eat brunch, lunch, anything. My favorite dish here is the B. benny which is eggs Benedict on a potato waffle (I live for potato waffles) with a hollandaise sauce. Cooked very well and taste even better. It comes with greens which taste good with their dressing and i usually get fruit. But honestly everything they serve is great. Since they are usually busy, the wait is a little on the longer side so I would say to come early morning. But this place is def worth the wait. Otherwise customer service is good when they have enough people working. Will continue coming back to any of their locations!

The Restaurant has nice Decor, but they take awhile just to serve you, a drink. How long does it take to give me a Ginger Ale. The hostess is nice, but they take awhile just for Chai Latte. There is Graffiti on the Wall outside. The experience is so so, I have had better, they need to make things a bit faster.
I couldn't eat because, the restaurant has a bunch of Bees that always just want apiece of your food, highly suggest sitting inside,
Bees are very unpleasant 
But besides that the food was good and on weekends at 10 they aren't so packed

This has become a go-to brunch place for me since I moved to the 'hood. 

The decor inside is pretty neat - as the old saying goes, no brunch place is complete without a fish tank. The service is pretty friendly, although often slow (mainly due to not having enough servers on hand and the fact that it's always packed in there). If you sit at the bar, you can watch all the food being cooked/plated (which is fun for some but gross for others) and joke around with the kitchen staff. 

Coffee-wise, their americanos are delish. Food-wise, everything I've had has been good - I normally get the Sammy Benny which is A+. Their menu is pretty big and includes lots of sweet and savoury options. There are also are a few different sides to choose from - the fruit is always fresh and delicious, which is a big deal to me. I weep when I get a side of fruit that is 95% watery honeydew melon.

My main criticism? Well, I suggest getting a table near the back if you can. In the winter, it's very cold near the front due to the door being continually opened and closed from people coming and going. In the summer, they open up all the front windows... which would be really nice, except that the place is OVERRUN with wasps (the insect, not  the socioeconomic group... although maybe that too). They seriously need to do something about that.

A solid brunch joint, in my humble opinion. There's usually a line, though, so be prepared to wait!

The food was moderately good. The menu is unique and I appreciated the gluten free options. However the wait for our Sunday brunch was about 45 minutes. It was also exceedingly slow to get someone to take our order. While waiting to pay, I saw staff texting on their cells. Unfortunately the service lets this place down. If it's Sunday, go to Lady Marmalade instead.

Having visited Starving Artist on St. Clair avenue, I entered a bit worried. My expectations weren't overly high. My fears were allayed. Yes there was a longish wait, but I expected that for a weekend. Once we got a table, service was excellent. I had the hitch hiker with gluten free waffles and I was very pleased with the entire plate. My guest had the western and was equally impressed. I had a delicious blueberry smoothie that I would also recommend. I am hoping that these high standard do not ever drop as I definitely plan to return. I would highly recommend that anyone requiring gluten free options try Starving Artist.
Great place to have brunch. Open and airy space made it a lively place. They specialize in waffle dishes so do yourself a favour and get those types of dishes!

My husband and I have been here quite a few times and our experiences have been inconsistent.

When we first started going for brunch about a year ago, the place would get busy but we never really waited for a seat or for service/food. The food was hot and delicious (if perhaps not all made from scratch). It became a quick brunch favourite.

My personal favourite is the Breakfast Benny (potato waffles, poached eggs, hollandaise, maple bacon, w/ side salad and either fruit salad, baked beans or potato salad). This is really filling and so satisfying when done right.

Lately, this place has really gone downhill. They don't seem to be able to keep up with their growing business. Service has been terrible - waiting forever for the hipster staff to get over their hangovers and take your order or bring your food over to the table. The food quality has gone down as well. The last time I was there, my eggs were so runny I was left with a pool of snotty egg whites on my plate, the bacon was far from crispy and my potato waffles were cold. Everything seemed rushed. Even the cappucino I got to kill the time between ordering and actually eating was cold on arrival and was mostly milk.

I'd really love to love this place again. When they do it right, it's so right, but they need to get it together with more staff and quality control.

My FAVOURITE spot for BRUNCH, definitely!!!!
I had tried different waffles and drinks, but my favourite is the smoked salmon waffle and the morrocan peppermint tea.

It's a waffle place, everything on waffle, between waffle, with mini waffle.. all tasty combinations worth trying. I also really like the side salad and potato salad that comes in some of the plates. Like the combination of it and the waffle.

The service is good average and the place is clean and big. The only problem is that they just accept cash. They have an ATM inside tho.

Be careful trying it, you can get addicted (like me)!

Fair warning: this restaurant has a bee and wasp problem. They mention this on a sign at the door, and they aren't kidding: we were seated inside, and had a few buzzing around the sweet items on our table throughout our meal. We watched customers squirm, swat, and finally move inside from the even waspier patio. If this is a dealbreaker, go elsewhere in the warmer seasons. 

Insects aside, the food is good to very good. Poached eggs were yolky and baked beans tasty. Oddly, our plates came with piles of undressed, dry greens; were they meant to be swirled in my hollandaise? A waffled Monte Cristo was satisfying, but wasn't the true, heavily cheesed melt-style treat that I had expected. I learned that they only serve espresso-based coffee when I got an americano after ordering a regular drip -- legit enough, but would have liked to know this earlier. The latte was strangely boozy-tasting, as if faintly sprayed with some kind of flavour shot. Popular with the thirtysomething, sharply barbered Bloordale set.

Waiting time is tooooo long. For one person, I came in before 11:30 but I did not start eating until 12:50pm...  the servers (2 ladies) were extremely busy and if they have one more server it will be much better. So they did not have much time to take care of me. It is okay, but I was so bored and unhappy after waiting for so long and nobody came to say a word. But the server did one nice thing that she got me a side potato mini waffle to avoid the confusion for chefs when I wanted a sub for my sandwich waffle.

Food, after such waiting, I was unhappy and it was not impressive enough to make me happy. Okay sandwich ( I ordered breakfast sandwich with bacon and egg). The egg was made with waffle maker, which looked interesting to me. The salad dressing was nice (vinegar). Hot chocolate was lucre warm, and was below average. The side potato waffle is over seasoned, a bit salty and I did not finish it. 

So far, this is okay. Maybe I ordered a wrong item. But the food does not make the wait worth.

The food is amazing! Waffles were delicious and great hollandaise sauce for the bennys. And they don't skimp on the side fruit you get.

Great service! The staff were very kind. Will definitely be back!

I had been waiting to try this place for a long time for its unique concept of using waffle as a base for every dish. I am not a big fan of waffle but I heard great reviews for this place and wanted to try it out. I got the waffle benny with chai latte and it was delicious :D the waffles and benny melted in mouth. The chai latte was good as well.
Eggs Benny.. Two poached eggs on potato waffles with caramelised bacon.. Perfection

Food was good but the place is criminally short staffed. Sunday at 11:30, waited 15 minutes for a table when there were 4 or 5 that hadn't been cleared yet. When we sat down, it was another 20min before the took our order and brought us cutlery. 

The whole time I was there, there was a lineup and empty tables. Hire more people!

Nothing too special. Typical brunch place with typical dishes but the taste was overall lacking. I tried the potato waffle with bacon. And pochard egg.  The fruit and salads on the side was not fresh and the Hollandaise source was tasteless. The pitched eggs where overdone.   Not a place I would go back to.

Great brunch on Saturday morning! We came as a group of 3 around 9.30AM and walked right in. Our server was really friendly and gave good recommendations on the menu. I had the eggs benny with greens and fruit on the side. Eggs were perfectly poaches and it was a good portion. Also had a decaf americano which was delicious as well. My friend got the western dish (western omelette between two waffles) which she really enjoyed, as well. A great addition to the neighbourhood brunch scene!

I'm a total morning person and love the breakfast/brunch focused menus. The menu is decently priced and is balanced between the sweet and savory dishes. Perfect for those people who need to satifsy their sweettooth in the early morns with items such as the caramel pecan waffle or fruity yogurt granola bowl. But I'm all about the savory. My "go-to" item on the menu are their Benny Waffles, especially the Sammy Benny which contains Atlantic Salmon costs only $13. It comes with 2 sides a choice of fresh light green salad or assorted fruits and a side of beans or potatoe salad. I recommend trying their potatoe salad, it's really good. You may even want to up your waffle to a potatoe waffle for a small extra charge. Sadly, Starving Artist will need to improve on their service. From the numerous times I've visited the St. Clair W location service was disappointing. It gets real busy and your caught waiting in line for about 10-15 minutes before someone actually notices you. You will need to get their attention if you want a spot.
The waffles are light amd fluffy, best waffles I've ever had! The eggs benedict was delicious, I like the meals come salad and fruit instead of greasy  sides - perfect balance of flavors

My aunt has taken to watching: 'You Gotta Eat Here!' And we meet up to hang out every so often.  She saw this place ( their Lansdowne location) and wanted to do brunch.  

After reading the reviews of the original and St Clair Ave West locations I decided that we would meet at the one on College. 

Location is easy to get to, and the decor is simple and clean which I give thumbs up! It was not too busy as we agreed to do a late brunch so perhaps we missed the breakfast crowd.  

The weather outside was warm so when water arrived at our table I thought it'd be ice cold....not quite but it wasn't warm so not a big worry.  

We both ordered the Breakfast waffle which consisted of potato waffles with caramelized bacon poached egg with salad and your choice of fruit salad, potato salad or baked beans.  Oddly enough it came with hollandaise which made it the B Benny but oh well.  My aunt had the baked beans while I had the fruit salad.  

In short it was delicious, I would have liked the egg a little more runny and the potato waffles a bit more toasted but the combination of everything was delicious!  I would caution you on the mixed greens that if you want more dressing to ask for it as it is almost non-existent.  

The service was good, not too pushy and not lazy.  Friendly in their suggestions without being blaz√© about it.  

This location is still waiting for their liquor license so be ware that no booze with your brunch! Worthwhile in coming back, I know I will!!!!

Thanks to Tobias and Byron for inventing the waffle-slider!  Byron the Builder did an amazing job renovating the interior (and does this professionally on the side?).

This schwanky night-spot doubles as a cozy lunch / brunch spot and your experience will be night and day depending on whether you go (surprise!) night or day.

I've enjoyed the brunch menu but happened by late one night and I had the waffle sliders with salad (fresh strawberries, almonds, crispy greens).  The two mini-burgers served on sweet belgian waffles and a to-die-for garlicky mayonnaise were a carnivore's delight.  Topped with standard burger veg (lettuce, tomato).  I had a chance to sample a massive nacho plate ordered by a nearby patron.  Friendly chat with random strangers and widely-acknowledged for extremely reasonable prices.
Four stars for the brunch and service. We were seated fast on a Sunday morning, however it took us forever to get our food...... Love the eggs!
Went there today. Really enjoyed our b Benny's. Great coffee too. You gotta eat here!

Oh....caramelized bacon, perfectly poached eggs filled with liquid gold, savory sweet waffles....Starving Artist brunch, how I love thee.  

I seriously think back to that first time I had brunch there and drool.  

Then, I sigh and think I don't want to deal with the lineup of yuppies all waiting for a table.  

The only reason why I gave this place 4/5 stars:  some (not all) of the customers suck.  Rude, inconsiderate, and obnoxious.  I'm sorry you have to "step over vagrants" to get to the restaurant, perhaps you should stick to Yorkville since evidently you think Lansdowne is full of thugs ready to mug you?  

The last time I was at the restaurant, the place was packed, wherever there was an open spot, you got seated.  My friend and I took a seat at the counter, which was perfect since then we could watch them cook and chat, but not everyone was so satisfied.   One large group in particular  sitting by the door was non-stop complaining and blocking the entrance.  Yes, I understand that sitting by the door sucks, especially in the winter, but you came there with six people, and that was the only table available at that time.  If the guy running the restaurant says "No" to your request to move tables (since the other table was spoken for), you don't go and then ask the waitress (who did not know that they had already asked the owner and he denied them) and get her in trouble.  Awesome.  Way to be dicks.  

Anyways, this place is really really special.  Highly recommend!

Had a second visit here last week - wasn't terribly busy, but experienced the same unusually long wait to get a menu and had to get up and search out the waitress again - but the staff were apologetic and sweet. 

Food was delicious as usual (and the cook was gracious to accommodate a food allergy) - but the reason for the 3 stars? The WASP problem. I ended up sitting in the back patio, which mercifully did not have wasps buzzing around (I also avoided ordering anything sugary or sweet, lest to attract them) but almost all the tables inside the place had fly swatters placed on them, with patrons looking slightly uncomfortable, trying to eat while swatting away wasps buzzing around their heads. 

It probably didn't help that I visited on a Wednesday morning, when the nearby streets are lined with with dozens of stinking garbage and recycling bins on the curb, waiting for pick-up (which probably exacerbates the wasp problem.) 

If the owners (or anyone associated) reads this, it would maybe help to wash down your tables, walls and floors with eucalyptus soap on a regular basis, as it's a natural repellent - I used to have a wasp and mosquito problem on my apartment balcony, but it worked like a charm. (I use Dr. Bronner's brand, found at most health stores.)

Long wait in line, but that's understandable. Waited 1/2 hour to order our food because the waitress was slow. Took over 1 HOUR for our food to arrive after ordering. No tables had any food for over 30 mins. All in all spent over 3 hrs here for waffles for god sakes. Food's good though, but why did it take so long?? Oh and bees, BEES EVERYWHERE!!

tl;dr Food's good, but not worth the wait. Don't come if you're allergic to bees.

Once I figured out how to order JUST waffles I was very impressed by the food. It was super speedy as well! There was street parking nearby for a Saturday morning and we didn't have to wait for a table. Reasonable prices, good food, friendly staff. I would definitely go back here if I was in the area.

A wonderful place to try something new if your in a rut from constantly dining at The Sunset grill or Cora's in the morning and want to try something different! This a fantastic place to eat. They specialize in different styles of waffles and my personal favour is the Loaded baked potato waffle. It is a must to have and it fills you up in the right spots! The service is good, and the place is spacious. I went back the next week for more!

I saw this place on a "best eggs benny" list, and I'd say that's a pretty big call, given competition in this city... But it's super tasty all the same. The eggs seem coddled versus poached (for those who care enough to distinguish), but the potato waffles are pretty great - especially with avocado - and coffee, service, fruit etc are all worth it. I did miss homefries, but the potato salad was a decent sub for the breakfast tradition. Worth a visit of two.

The potato waffles are seriously delicious. The Breakfast Benny was definitely the way to go. But had to wait a while to be seated do to the size of the place. So also not a great place to go with a group. Two people is the optimum number per party... And the potato waffle is really the only thing that put it over the top for me. It was good, but I haven't hurried back for more... yeah know?

I was guided here by my partner without advanced research (unusual for me) and was surprised when I learned that *everything* came on, with, or between waffles. I was skeptical for a minute but then we all loved it. I had the B.Benny and the potato waffles (I was somehow thinking potato flour but it was really mashed potatoes) were so filling I could only eat half the order. My partner had the spicy chicken sandwich and we agreed it was amazing. The youngster in our party (4 and 7) thought having a grilled cheese with waffles was hilarious and that the mini waffles were super cute Girls loved the beans, which were surprisingly sweet. Great service. Nice people. Good location. Wish they took cards, but that's my only small complaint.

Experience was terrible. Inside there was no AC, they even had to leave the front door open. When I got inside, the wait was 20 minutes a table (which is fine since the reviews were good and I assumed it's worth the wait for good food...). Once we got a table, the waitress then asked us to delay our food orders and simply order drinks first because the kitchen is backed up.

Put the orders in and the wait was almost another 50 minutes (don't really understand why it would take so long to fry an egg on top of a waffle with cut fruit and salad). At that point I was starving (I guess that's where the name 'starving artist' came from). Once the food arrived, it just tasted average at best and that's ontop of being really hungry. Portions were small for the price.

If anyone were to come here for a visit, I would think twice before coming for average food you can get elsewhere for half the wait time.
Eggs Benny on potato waffle is amazaballs! More bacon and more space next time and i'll give it a 5!

For brunch this place is pretty cute! I went to the one on the west side of bloor and there wasn't a long line up on a Sunday morning for brunch. The concept is pretty good - waffle on ERRRRYTHING. I also had a chocolate milkshake that was great, sweet and helped my sweet tooth at noon :) 

The egg benedicts were cooked pretty well and oozed when it should. I like that their waffles are also the right amount of crunch and sweetness to balance the savoury on top of it.

Nice concept but food isn't that great. What's with the cash only policy? I'm very iffy of restaurants with that policy (tax purposes...). Service is bad, i watched the sever wiped the table and let the crumbs fall on the floor. 

I don't get the hype of the potato waffle at all. I thought the potato waffle would be light and crisp, similar to latkes, instead I found the texture to be quite mussy. The poached egg is fine, I mean, you can't call yourself a brunch place if you mess up a poached egg anyways.

My friend got the Spicy chicken waffle for $12 and the chicken was dry and bland, no sign of jalapeno at all.

Gary & I love you guys so much that we keep coming back for so much love & wonderful potato waffle bennys. We are happy to to have 2 options to fill our tummies with tasty treats every Sunday. We have felt so at home here that we celebrated our wedding brunch at the original Starving thanks to the lovely Marianna and it was the sweetest & most savoury day to date:) Taylor, Nikki and Lolly we are your fans forever!!! Xox

I wanted to love this place. I think it's quite hard to mess up brunch items and the meal I had at Starving Artist wasn't terrible but it wasn't amazing either. I had read so many rave reviews about this place and was somewhat let down during my visit. I ordered the "Waffle Benny" (carmelized bacon on waffles with hollandaise) with a side of salad greens and fruit. The wait for our food wasn't super long and the place was busy for a weekday afternoon. However, the water jug and glasses seemed a little dirty and could have been cleaned better. 
When the food arrived, it looked great. Brunch is definitely the most "photogenic meal" and as legend dictates, if you don't stop to Instagram your meal, did you really eat it? Anyways, back to the meal, the hollandaise wasn't broken and had a great consistency while the eggs had the most magically round shape. The waffles tasted like your standard Eggo waffle which was the biggest disappointment. I didn't expect to like the carmelized bacon but it was great. The side salad was standard and something quickly thrown together while the fruit looked old and tasted over ripe. My dining companion ordered the smoked salmon benny which she enjoyed. Our meals came up to about $12-$13 per person which I thought was fair though I probably would've given one more star if they were lower. 
The main reason I gave Starving Artist a 3 star review was that I don't understand the hype with this place. Their waffle tasted like a store bought mix and their potato salad is definitely from a store-bought tub. It was a good meal but not special.
Eggs Benny where delicious. Reasonable portions, not large which leaves room for dessert. Don't go pee with the door open.

Just came back from this wonderful brunch place. We have a party of 6 and arrived there at 11am, took us over an hour to wait in a line to get a table. The place is not huge, typical boutique brunch place.

What surprises me is the attitude of the waitress and waiter. They have patience and organized manner to get things ordered.

There's no back kitchen, it is like a bar style where you see how they make their orders.

What surprises me even more is the presentation of the meal. It is buzy during peak hour for Sunday brunch and we have a group of 6, we ordered Breakfast waffle, The hitchhiker, breakfast benny x2, salmon sandiwch and 3 other dessert waffle. The presentation of those dish were not sacrificed!  

We did not have to wait too long for the meal and of course they are delicious!

The only thing I find is the mini waffle felt abit 'empty' yet it is still delicious. The potato waffle is great! Although I won't have more than two. It gets 'heavy'.

Everything is waffle based including sandwiches. Delicious and the price was reasonable. 

We have latte for each person, main meal for each person and dessert and appetizer (share by 6), the total bill comes to be around $20. Not bad. 

I will definitely come visit here again probably summer time.
one of fav brunch places. especially when I crave waffles. go before 11 to avoid lineups

You'd think that, given how cool this place looks and feels, it would be a much better experience. But, it was totally disappointing.

Popped in here with my girlfriend, allured by the line out the door and the interesting looking menu (waffle everything), and waited patiently to be seated. Upon being seated, we were treated to pretty awful service from a girl who seemed to hate her job, and when asking her even the simplest question, were glared at like we were committing a crime.

The food itself was average to below average. My girlfriend went with the gluten free option, and it was yuck. I don't recommend it. My food was average, nothing special, but still satisfying as it was the kind of food I was looking for that morning (bacon, eggs, waffles). 

It's funny that they named this joint "Starving Artist", because if this was an artist, it deserves to starve. I know they get people in the door with their trendy vibe, but it's just not worth it. There are so many better options in the city, although, sadly, I don't know if there are any great ones in this part of town.
Amazing waffles! Service is good, vibe is great, not too expensive. I had breakfast and was served pretty quickly. Would definitely go here again!

Service is terrible. There was one waitress who had a stinky attitude. I don't know if she isn't getting paid enough but don't take it out on customers. The medium length dark haired waitress should really get her attitude checked, and learn how to speak to customers in a more polite tone. And of course, wasps EVERYWHERE. Doesn't matter whether you're sitting outside or inside no matter what they say. They are everywhere especially once the food comes. 
Food was pretty good, but you can find many other places just as good if not better with waitresses who don't speak to you as if you just kicked their dog. 

1/5 - would not come back

While on a short trip to Toronto we stopped at Starving Artist for breakfast. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived and there was no line up. I heard this place gets pretty busy. We were told it would take about 20 minutes to get a table. The patrons finished up sooner than expected and we were seated within 5. This place is really tight and uncomfortable so be prepared to 'dance' with people while they leave and you enter.

While I waited, I did take a look around the kitchen and the espresso machine and could see what people were writing about. This place REALLY needs a good wipe down. The lion statue at the front, don't get too close, it's covered in hair which is strange since its concrete. Maybe its art?

Cleanliness aside, I was able to get past this once I saw the menu and the pics on Yelp. One word, waffles. Waffles everywhere. Whether you're after a savory breakfast or a sweet one, Starving Artist will give you what you crave. 

I had the Hitchhicker's Breakfast and everyone else at my table had the B. Benny. The B. Benny is made with potato waffles and wow were they tasty! I LOVED the caramelized bacon. A perfect hint of sweetness and cooked perfectly. 

I like that the breakfast came with a bit of fruit and also some greens. The 2 mini waffles were a great treat without making me feel too bad about it. 

From the moment we sat down until the moment we left, there was a line of at least 8 people waiting, outside, in the cold. When people are waiting outside and its negative degrees outside? Yep, it must be good.

I'm sad I don't get to visit Toronto as much as I used to because I could definitely see myself becoming a frequent customer at Starving Artist.
The Waffle sandwiches are great! A small, light and fluffy waffle. I had the Chicken Bacon Club. Enjoyed it very much! The coffee is great too! BRUNCH ALL DAY!  :D

I recently visited this restaurant for a quick bite to eat with some vegan friends as we seen the menu had some vegan options. We were surprisingly disappointed in the waffles that were the main it on the menu, everything was paired with these waffles. The staff were per occupied with changing music, talking to one another and making more of these horrid waffles. No smile or acknowledgement when we walked through the door, one man simply stated "how many" and then "sit here". the place wasn't busy 4-5 tables full. i had the eggs Benedict as m vegan friends had the veggie waffle sandwich. This was a horrid mix of soggy tomatoes, black avocados and peppers. They had a horrible watery version of Aunt Jemima syrup.. keep in mind THEY ARE A WAFFLE HOUSE! Given we are in Canada it is easy to get quality maple syrup across the street!! 

the one star was for the coffee....

Very lazy service staff.  20 ppl waiting and 10 tables but not sitting anyone.

I'm by the food preparation station and after the bell rings, it takes 5 Mins for someone to grab it.  The food is getting cold! 

I see the staff just hanging around and talking. 

Very frustrating experience.

Food was good though. If not I would have gave it 1 star.

This Waffle and Espresso bar is a wonderful addition to the Bloor-Lansdowne neighbourhood. The waffles are truly exceptional and the coffee here is amazing.  Breakfast is a bang for your buck!  We had the starving artist waffles and the hitchiker waffles with coffee - spent $20 and left feeling full. I couldn't even finish the fruit on my plate. 

The atmosphere is great with two patios and an inviting indoor space and the staff is super friendly. I can't wait to go back to Starving Artist! Looking forward to trying the nacho waffles with drinks on a wed night. They have a jazz band play there every Wed.

3/5 not because of the food (which was GREAT) but the service was AWFUL. 

A very busy place especially during brunch. We were first greeted by the cashier who told us to take a seat on the couches... but we waited a good 15 minutes and started noticing that 3 other larger groups (3-4 people) got seats before us. We then asked one of the servers and they clearly forgot about us and sent us back on the waiting couch. 

You do wait another 20 minutes for food... It's kind of funny how they actually make you STARVE for your waffles. 

The potato-waffles are a must-try and the poached eggs were amazing!! We truly enjoyed it. 

They also only take cash. The cashier must have been a new employee, as we ended up paying more than we should have... but we just wanted to leave. 

Hopefully service is better off at the Lansdowne location.

The cash only thing is really annoying. They also don't bring you a bill and you have to pay at the cash, and then they don't offer you your change when you pay. A forced tip. Strange.

The food is ok and good coffee but the cash only thing is too annoying for me.
Relaxed atmosphere and great service. Had the most delectable and rich hollandaise sauce and poached egg ever. Couldn't get enough of the potato waffle and the potato salad was moist and delish.

One of my favourite brunch places! Love the vibe of the restaurant, it's almost like a half art gallery half restaurant. The service is also very welcoming and comfortable, and their menu is spectacular. I order a waffle eggs benny, with a side of green salad and potato salad. Everything about this meal was perfection. No complaints at all about the dish I tried. 

I took away a star only because the restaurant is tiny and the waits are typically pretty long. I wish Starving Artist wasn't so difficult to commute to! But I will definitely still be making another visit.

This is the kind of place you come once for the experience in my opinion. Came in with 2 friends on a Saturday morning around 10:45am. There was a line, we waited about 40 minutes for a table- to be expected. Beware if you are hung over, this place blares music with heavy bass.

The service is very slow. The servers were very slow to clear tables after patrons left. 3+ empty tables waiting to be cleaned as we stood in line. This was discouraging to watch as the lines grew to be out the door. Once we were seated we ordered drinks. I saw the americanos being served and they looked extremely strong in tiny cups. I asked for an americano in a tall latte cup with extra hot water. I found it enjoyable and I'm glad I requested the extra water. Our drinks were long finished by the time our food came over half an hour later.

 I ordered the Chicken Bacon. Didn't see our server once as we ate. My meal was ok, I don't think the chicken was freshly cooked, tasted like packaged pre-sliced chicken. The sauce made the waffle soggy and it was messy.

It's a cool concept, and it's reasonably priced. I saw some of the dessert waffles come out and they looked awesome. Unfortunately after 2 hours there we decided to leave. If you like waffles I would recommend trying this place out during the week and trying one of the sweet waffles.

Poor service, same lousy waffle mix packaged waffles, and microwave eggs. 

Potato salad is packaged,  and coffee is over priced. 

Not a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Try emma's down the street if you want home made food.

If you want assembled food save money and goto mcdonalds
Store bought potato salad. Microwave eggs. Store bought waffle mix. Hugely disappointing.

Ordered: Mango Juice + Fully Loaded 

Food 4.5/5 - the fully loaded is very good, but the mango juice is just like any other. 

Price 3.5/5 - the mango juice is a bit pricy for the amount that we get and doesn't taste all that special. The fully loaded waffle was fairly priced

Service 4/5 - quick in service and food was served quite quickly. 

Complaints: Cash only although it has an ATM machine but it's still inconvenient.

What initially drew me in about this spot was the buzz about everything served on waffles... it's true! And not just breakfast either - all burgers and sandwiches are served on waffles instead of bread/buns. The Monte Cristo is a must try and I'd say opt for the potato salad over the fruit as a side.

This is BUSY spot for weekend brunch (you will wait ages for a table) so I tend to opt for dinner or late night drinks. Take friends and enjoy the use of countless board games, good beer, and DEFINITELY try out the waffle bacon (the owners apparently spent countless hours perfecting how to cook the bacon into the waffle and I think they've certainly mastered it)... I suggest adding a side of whipped cream to up the gluttony factor.

Inside is a bit warm in summer and sometimes too loud, but if there aren't seats on the patio out front, head to the back - there is another!

I'm surprised this place is as popular as it is. They don't know how to make waffles, and they have horrible service! We got the french toast waffles, they had absolutely no flavor were disgusting looking and raw inside (picture attached) save your money and go somewhere else

Came here just before lunch time for some food right before the place filled up with guests. Even still it took a few minutes before we could be seated due to the fact that one girl was taking care of the entire restaurant on her own which is a lot for one person. Anyway, I ordered the Monte Cristo which was decently filling but nothing spectacular for the price; I had a chocolate peanut butter shake which I really enjoyed. Considering how much our server had to do, she did a good job of getting us our food, drinks and bill on time. I would come again if I am in the area but I think there are better brunch spots for the price to go to in Toronto.

I learned of The Starving Artist when I stumbled upon a picture of an Eggs Benedict on a waffle rather than on an English muffin. The image I saw intrigued me, and knew that I had to check it out for myself. An All-Day-Breakfast joint, and everything is made on a waffle? Sign me up! So I gave the Lansdowne location a call, and asked if they took reservations. They said no, but that they would try to accommodate my request, and will sit my party and I together if we arrive by 9:30am on a Saturday morning. This was still very early for me, but I wanted a pretty large group to sit together (8 of us). So I made everyone arrive by 9am, and as promised, they sat all of us together.

What I always have to get when I visit The Starving Artist is the peanut butter, chocolate and banana smoothie for $5. It is to die for! I also like to get the grilled cheese for $4-do note that the grilled cheese is made with processed cheese. I love it, but many may not like the "processed" aspect. I have also gotten the Waffle Bacon for $6 (bacon dipped in waffle batter then pressed in the waffle iron, served with real maple syrup) on more than one occasion. And of course, I always get the Benny! Something else I want to note is that they are quite flexible for those with allergies etc.

SIDES & SUBSTITUTIONS

Avocado (4 slices)...3.50
Caramelized Bacon(4 slices)...3.50
Potato Salad...3
Baked Beans...2
Mini Waffle...1.25 each
Potato Waffle...2.25 each
Vegan Gluten Free Waffles...2.25 each
Bacon = Avocado...FREE
Bacon =Tomatoes...FREE
Reg = Potato...1
Reg = Vegan...1
Reg = Gluten Free...1
Also, there is a new location at 1078 St. Clair Ave. W. Review from BlogTo here. I have heard that the new location is not great, but maybe things have improved since they opened-always gotta give restaurants a bit of time to work out the kinks.

I loved The Starving Artist the first time I visited, but overtime it has lost its luster. I guess with so many brunch options in the city, I rather try a new place, than return for a waffle breakfast. Don't get me wrong, the food is tasty, but not tasty enough to make the trek on a regular basis.

http://wp.me/p2mHMr-187

Who doesn't like an egg benedict on a waffle?  I don't come here often, but when I do I always get the Sammy Benny for lunch and it is YUMMY!  The food is always delicious and filling, and the service has gotten faster.  I also like the different artwork they put up every time I visit.  They have front and back patios open during summer, it gets really hot inside as they have no air condition.  The only off-putting thing is the fish tank there looks kind of dirty, I wouldn't sit near it.

Love this place! So happy they have expanded and now have 3 locations - I truly already miss the original Landsdowne location as I had been going there for years but luckily my house is inbetween that one, college and the st Clair location!! So lucky me I get delicious eggs Benedict on potato waffles whenever I please mmmmm mmm deliciousness

Came here on a Saturday around the noon hour with some friends and my baby and the place was packed. We were seated surprisingly quick based on how busy the restaurant looked and our server was very accommodating in ensuring that we had space for my daughter who was in her car seat. 

I ordered the B Benny with side potato salad, both of which were super tasty. I would come back again and again for that alone, except that service was extremely slow. 

If you're craving something a little different, I would highly recommend this place, just make sure you're not in a rush to be anywhere afterwards

Tried this place for the first time for brunch. Had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated, but once we were inside the service was fast. 

I ordered the Western on a waffle with avocado, which came with a side of fruit and salad. The salad didn't have much flavour but the waffles were delicious! So fluffy! 

It was definitely a great brunch spot with endless waffle options!

MINI WAFFLES ARE CRAZY GOOD

I've ordered the Waffle Benny and Strawberry Craze...I didn't regret it. The waffles they make are amazingly delicious. I will definitely come back and try the other waffle dishes or even get the exact same dishes! Service was also very good and friendly! Must try if you're visiting from afar.

I've been here a few times but unfortunately the last time was not a good experience. Half of my meal (Monte Cristo) was accidentally thrown out after I asked for it to be packed up to go. They said they would make it again for me. All I got was a plain waffle. The ham, turkey and havarti cheese was missing. And I was charged full price for their mistake which was $17. Lesson learned.

Food was good! Not great but good enough that we would definitely go back. We ordered the Bennys. Service was ok too. We were there at around 11am and there were only 3 tables occupied. Might be the reason why we got good service compared to the other reviewers. 

By the way, they only accept CASH which sucks because I don't like bringing a lot of cash with me and I prefer to pay with plastic.
Waffles grilled cheese was the ultimate brunch item. But menu listed alcohol and apparently they don't have a liquor license so they don't serve it.

The best eggs benedict I've ever had. Seriously.
I had the B Benny. The potato waffles were amazing, I don't know how they make them but they're magic. A slight crisp on the outside and soft and potatoey on the inside. I loved the caramelized bacon, it's the perfect amount of sweet and savoury. The mixed greens paired well with the poached eggs and waffles, since they had a more acidic dressing on them which balance out the richer and savoury food. The fruits were fresh and sweet, making them a great way to finish the dish.

My girlfriend and I went here based on the fact she was craving for waffles that morning. We drove about 25-30 km to get to this place and boy, it was well worth it. It can be tough to get a seat but since it's a good place for brunch, people come and go quickly. I ordered the Hitchhiker which came with two mini waffles, four caramelized bacon strips, cheesy scrambled eggs with the choice of an assortment of fruit, potato salad or baked beans. The bacon strips were mediocre but WOWZA the waffles were amazing! (it is a waffle bar). My girlfriend ordered the Breakfast Benny and I could tell it was a popular item because I can hear nearby customers ordering the same item. It came with Potato Waffles, poached eggs, bacon with hollandaise sauce to top it all off. Potato waffles were OK but not GREAT. it just tasted like mashed potatoes in the form of a waffle. 

There are a lot of customization options: vegan/ gluten free as well as replacing bacon with avacado. 

Overall, I enjoyed the food. they have nice, random and comedic superhero paintings displayed all over. Their basic waffle is amazing and apparantly you can order a chicken club that's wrapped in waffles. This place is a must try for another who is around the area or whoever is happening to crave for waffles.

Delicious foodage!

Nice little patio too (too bad the rain sent us inside). 

I had the Breakfast Waffle (2 poached eggs, bacon, on top of 2 potato waffles) The potato waffles are gorgeous, could really taste the chives. Comes served with a green salad as well as your choice of potato salad, fruit salad or bakes beans.

Now I really want to go back and try the regular waffles. The guy next to us was eating blueberry ones and they looked tasty.

Waitress seemed a bit out of it (hungover?) - bringing someone else's bill to our table plus crashing some dishes around at another table, but otherwise was serving us in a very friendly manner.

Food was delicious,  staff was courteous and friendly. Short wait for food. Had the potato waffle with some egg and other stuff. Potato salad so good. Really want to try their spicy chicken meal. My friend said it was delicious.  Must try!!!

I did not think I liked waffles. If you feel the same, try the potato waffles at Starving Artist and your life will change for the better. I had the Hitchhiker: two mini waffles (potato, please) and cheesy scrambled eggs. I substituted avocado for the bacon. The fruit that accompanied my meal tasted very fresh. My fellow diners also remarked on the fruit as they cleaned their waffle-filled plates. Busy, busy place but worth the wait.

Chose to come here for brunch on a Friday morning because I love waffles and I heard they serve waffle everything. Choosing a meal was hard but thank goodness for Yelp reviews. I opted for the Sammy Benny and my boyfriend got the B Benny, both with a side of fruits. I thought the salmon was a bit fishy, didn't have that smokiness I like. I did enjoy the potato waffle a whole lot more than the regular waffle so would recommend. It is a dollar charge to substitute a waffle for potato waffle however. 

There was only server working so service was slow throughout. Cash only as well. It's a nice bright restaurant close to where we live so we may come back for breakfast again to try the other waffle options but we're in no hurry.

I've been to Starving Artist Bar a few times, and have ordered a few things off the menu. Specifically, I can highly recommend the "starving for vegan" (the vegan waffles are fantastic) the "starving for waffles" (these are both breakfast meals with eggs, waffles, and fruit. I've also ordered the Waffle benny, which was delicious- the hollandaise was very very good. 

My boyfriend (who I usually go with) ALWAYS orders "dessert" for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Dessert generally consists of waffles, ice cream, chocolate chips (baked right into the waffles) fruit, and whipped cream. Intense. The portion is large (I couldn't finish it, but he always does) and they have real maple syrup, and the whipped cream is home-made (not from an aerosol can). Lastly, I've had the grilled cheese waffle sandwich there, and while I was slightly terrified at the thought of sweet and salty like that together-- it was easily the best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had. 

The artwork they have on display is always fantastic, and the inclusion of boardgames is a nice touch (especially during dinner and drinks). 

The service is not awesome, but then again, they're always busy. I would, and certainly WILL go back.

The word to describe this place is RANDOM. It's in a converted house, on a residential street. I've never been for the breakfast/lunch thing - I've been here at night. This takes random to a whole new level.

They have live music and booze. It's a full on bar at night. In a house. On a residential street. RANDOM. But tres cool. It's a very comfortable spot, and a great little neighborhood hangout. A friend of mine lives around the corner and introduced me to the place. We went for desert one night. Or perhaps I should say, she went for dessert. I went for a pint. And was treated to a live band to boot.

I can't speak to the food, but she said it was delicious (something with banana in it). They had a good beer selection, so I was pleased. This place is kind of small and out of the way for a special trip from any kind of distance. But for anyone in Bloordale, Blandsdowne, and whatever else they call this neighborhood, I would definitely recommend checking it out. If for no other reason because I think the location and spot is kinda hilarious.

What would our trip to Toronto have been without this delightful nook of deliciousness?? Who is awesome enough to serve breakfast until 5pm??? And they make gluten-free waffles!?!!?? Not to mention, the best, most AUTHENTIC Americano I've had outside Italy!!!!

This little place is a gem. Nestled amongst a residential neighborhood (which seems to be a theme in Toronto, one that I love ps), you feel like you've really come to a secret local's place. I love the open "bar" concept where food is prepared insight at a bar-like counter. And the ample seating in the front patio is perfect for a late afternoon meal. But even if you sit inside, the floor to ceiling window that fully opens makes you feel like you're outside anyway, minus the wind messing up ya hair of course.

The Americano.
